title: iOS Developer
description:
**Are you driven by the elegance of building beautiful user interfaces and the reward of solving challenging technical problems? At Framna, we are looking for a Junior iOS Developer who is excited to grow, curious about how great products are made, and ready to take the next step in their iOS journey. If you love Swift, enjoy learning from others, and want to help build apps used by millions, all while being part of a supportive team where questions are welcome and learning is part of the job, we would love to meet you.**

**Become part of the team**
---------------------------


Framna partners with some of the world’s most ambitious brands, like Swish, SJ, Essity, and SEB, to create digital products that define markets and deliver real-world impact. We are now more than 600 people across ten studios, building apps used by millions every day.


As our next Junior iOS Developer, you will be part of a cross-functional product team of designers, developers, QA engineers, analysts, and product leads who take ideas from first concept to real-world product.


On top of that, you will contribute to our iOS competence area, a company-wide group where app developers meet regularly to exchange knowledge, deepen their skills, and grow professionally together.

**What you will do**
--------------------


As a Junior iOS Developer, you will work alongside experienced teammates to build modern iOS experiences and grow your skills through hands-on learning.


More specifically, you will:

* Build features in Swift using SwiftUI and/or UIKit and modern iOS frameworks.
* Contribute to clean, maintainable code and learn solid engineering practices along the way.
* Work closely with designers and your product team to bring UI ideas to life and make apps feel smooth, accessible, and user-friendly.
* Help solve platform-specific challenges and learn how to make good technical decisions with support from senior developers.
* Participate in technical discussions, pairing sessions, and code reviews to sharpen your craft.
* Collaborate with product managers, designers, and developers, gaining insight into how real products are built from concept to launch.
* Keep learning, stay curious, and grow your confidence as an iOS developer.

**Who you are**
---------------


You will thrive here if you are curious, eager to learn, and genuinely excited about iOS development. You might recognise yourself if you:

* Have some experience building iOS apps in Swift (professionally or through internships/personal projects), or you are excited to dive in.
* Love learning from others and enjoy improving a little every day.
* Communicate clearly, ask a lot of questions, and collaborate well with designers and developers.
* Are comfortable taking feedback, trying new things, and exploring different ways to solve a problem.
* Care about user experience and want to build products that feel thoughtful and well made.
* It’s a plus if you speak Swedish.

**About Framna**
----------------


Framna means ‘to bring forward’ in Old Norse. And that is exactly what we do. We partner with industry leaders (and those about to be) to create excellent digital products that define markets, reshape industries, and deliver meaningful impact.


Born from the union of digital agencies Bontouch, Move, and Shape, Framna emerged from a strong, product-led culture. Today, over 600 of us collaborate across ten studios in Denmark, the Netherlands, Poland, Sweden, Switzerland, and the US.


Every day, millions of users around the world rely on the products we help shape. From seamless payments to daily commutes, from better health management to smarter shopping. Our work consistently earns an average App Store rating of 4.5.


Together with some of the world’s most ambitious brands, including Essity, SJ, Swish, and SEB, we craft products that lead markets and push boundaries. Because when products win, businesses win. We call it Win by product.

**What you get**
----------------

* **For us, it’s office first.** Our cozy Stockholm office is our main location for work. Right in the middle of the city – a welcoming space where there’s always something happening, whether it is a demo, a fika, or someone testing out a new idea. We spend time together to build culture, optimise for stronger collaboration, better products, and greater value for our partners and challenging ourselves while having fun doing it. We mix that with the freedom to work from home when it makes sense, and hours that flex around real life.
* **A culture of curiosity.** On Fridays we have weekly demos, Wednesdays mean lunch-and-learns, and sometimes we throw ourselves into conceptathons just to see what happens. We gather for company conferences just to share ideas, and we take time to learn something new when needed.
* **The freedom to follow your “what if.”** We believe the best roles are shaped by the people in them. If you are curious about something, you will have the trust and space to chase it, and probably a few teammates who want to jump in with you.
* **Teammates who bring their whole selves.** Designers who doodle during standups, engineers who can’t resist showing off a clever hack, product leads who keep the energy up when things get tricky. Around here, people genuinely like sharing what they know and celebrating when someone tries something new.
* **And of course, the benefits you’d expect.** A generous wellness grant, top-up on your parental leave, occupational pension, and plenty more to make life outside of work easier.

**Our hiring process**
----------------------

* First interview with our recruiter, Josephine
* Case assignment
* Technical interview with two developers
* Final meeting with our Head of iOS

**Please note:** For this role, you need to be based in Sweden. Unfortunately, we are not able to offer relocation.

title: Backend developer
description:
We are looking for senior backend engineers to join us and expand our team of talented backend developers. You share a passion for building systems that delivers high business value without sacrificing maintainability, availability, scalability and quality. You will work on the backend systems that power our casino platform and help us deliver the best customer experience.
   

  

**Job Description**
* Design, develop and help operate our systems
* Drive technical improvements throughout the stack
* Together with product teams deliver the best games and business solutions
* Help scale our solution to customer requirements and business opportunities


 Who you are
   

  

* You have 5+ years of experience working in a mixed Java, SQL, Javascript environment
* Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent
* You are passionate about working in an environment of continuous learning
* You are curious, driven and not afraid to take charge and improve the system and add automation where needed
* Taking on technical challenges and solving them is something you take pride in
* You have experience from working on large Java systems and have a solid understanding of performance, scalability and availability challenges of distributed systems
* Quality, not only of the code you write, but the delivered system is important to you
* You thrive in an environment where you are responsible for your code and takes ownership of the change from editor to production system
* You know your way around a modern Unix/Linux system
* Experience with modern deployment, monitoring and logging solutions


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Senior Software Frontend Development Engineer
description:
At norbloc we build ecosystems for sharing of validated data, as well as solutions for financial institutions looking to digitize and improve the efficiency of client onboarding and data management processes. Our client portfolio includes government institutions and tier-1 financial organizations, reflecting norbloc's trusted partnerships with leading entities across different regions.
   

  

 We are now growing our Development team to strengthen our products, which focuses on KYC functionality and integrations. To this direction, we are seeking a
 **Senior Development Engineer (Frontend & Development)** 
 , reporting to the Development Lead.
   

  

 By joining norbloc, you will have the exceptional opportunity to be part of a highly innovative and pioneering company. Our platforms are disrupting the status quo of how KYC is conducted, solving challenges that have existed for decades, and in doing so creating a new market segment where other innovative solutions and applications can thrive.
   

  

**The role is Hybrid in Athens and on a full-time basis.**
**Role Description**
 As a Senior Development Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining frontend components and related functionality of our platforms. You will collaborate closely with backend developers, QA engineers, and product managers to deliver robust, secure, and user-friendly solutions tailored to client and regulatory requirements. The role requires strong technical expertise in front-end development, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to adapt to diverse project contexts.
   

  

 Duties and responsibilities
   

  

* Develop, enhance, and maintain frontend features for the application basis the platform design and architecture
* Collaborate with backend engineers and the Development Lead to design and deliver end-to-end solutions
* Write clean, modular, and well-tested code that aligns with engineering best practices
* Optimize application performance, response time, scalability, and security
* Ensure front-end compatibility and accessibility as per web3 standards
* Participate in design and code reviews, ensuring high-quality deliverables
* Translate UI/UX designs into functional components while maintaining usability and accessibility standards
* Document technical specifications and provide support for deployment and integration
* Stay current with emerging frontend technologies and incorporate them where relevant


**Requirements**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience
* 5+ years of professional experience in frontend development
* Strong proficiency with modern frontend frameworks (e.g., Angular, React)
* Solid knowledge of JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML5, CSS3, and responsive design
* Experience with APIs, RESTful services, and frontend-backend integration
* Familiarity with relational databases (PostgreSQL preferred)
* Experience with Git and CI/CD workflows
* Strong communication and collaboration skills
* Fluency in English
* Experience in Fintech, RegTech or enterprise SaaS and familiarity with blockchain-based platforms or distributed architectures will be considered as a plus


**Benefits**
* Become part of a friendly, innovative and ambitious team
* Learn and grow in a pioneering, high-growth environment
* Work with world-leading financial institutions and government entities
* Exposure to cutting edge technologies and methodologies
* Competitive compensation package

title: Fullstack Developer — Build the Brains Behind the World’s First AI Operating System
description:
🚀 Join Voitto – where the future of work builds itself
   

  

 Are you the kind of person who spins up a server just to test something for fun? Do you get a kick out of automating away your own tasks, and then automating the automation? At Voitto, we’re building something that’s never been built before: an intelligent operating system for business—the world’s first
 **true AI OS** 
 .
   

  

 Forget building “just another app.” We’re crafting a living system—an layer where specialized AI agents create tools, learn from real use, and orchestrate complex workflows across your business, all while respecting the systems you already use.
   

  

 We need a fullstack developer who can help us architect and implement this reality.
   

  

 🧠 About the Role
   

  

 You’ll be at the heart of our AI system—designing APIs, automating flows, and creating both backend services and frontends that bring our agent-based operating system to life.
   

  

**You Will**
* Design and build backend systems and APIs that support our AI agents
* Develop frontends to visualize workflows and help humans interact with the system
* Automate processes and build internal tools to speed up development
* Help research and implement creative solutions to technical challenges (we love “deep dives”)
* Contribute to a living, self-learning product architecture that evolves over time


**🧰 You’ll Thrive Here If You**
* Have a strong command of Linux/Unix systems
* Understand “classic” backend principles (queues, APIs, databases, services, etc.)
* Are comfortable working across the full stack—from backend logic to the frontend UI
* Are excited by emerging AI technologies, but grounded enough to know when to build something from scratch
* Love finding clever solutions to complex problems
* Enjoy reading into weird corners of the internet to figure out how someone else solved a tricky problem
* Work well independently but thrive in a smart, collaborative environment


 If you’re someone who prefers building real systems over tweaking pixels—and gets excited by the idea of building something
 **fundamentally new** 
 —you’ll feel right at home.
   

  

 🎯 Our Mission
   

  

 We’re creating the world’s first
 **true AI Operating System** 
 —a system that doesn’t just run apps, it creates them. An AI workforce that collaborates, learns, and evolves—integrated deeply into your infrastructure but respectful of your data, workflows, and people.
   

  

**We’re Building An OS That**
* Generates its own tools and connectors
* Orchestrates work across agents, humans, and existing software
* Operates securely and privately within your own infrastructure
* Starts as an empty canvas and builds itself


 💫 What You’ll Get
   

  

* Stockholm office – Join us in our collaborative Stockholm workspace.
* A passion-driven culture – We’re building something meaningful, and we love doing it
* A like-minded team – Smart, ambitious, curious, and always down to help each other grow
* A focus on learning – Regular knowledge sharing, pair programming, and a culture of continuous growth
* The chance to help shape a fundamental shift in how humans and machines work together


 🛠 Tech stack?
   

  

 We won’t bore you with a long list of buzzwords. If you know your way around modern web and backend development, are comfortable in a terminal, and like building things that are useful, you’re probably a good fit. We’re not religious about specific frameworks—we pick what makes sense.
   

  

 ✨ How to Apply
   

  

 We’re not looking for a perfect resume. Just show us
 **what you’ve built** 
 .
   

  

* Share your GitHub, side projects, code samples, or even a clever shell script you’re proud of.
* Tell us why this mission speaks to you.
* Bonus points if you’ve ever said: “There must be a better way to do this,” and then built it.


 Let’s build something the world hasn’t seen before.
   

  

**Voitto — The First True AI Operating System.**
 No recruiters, no fluff. Just a team of passionate humans building the future.

title: Frontend Developer — Not just building software. Creating living systems
description:
You’re here because something sparked curiosity. Maybe it’s the promise of working with AI that truly matters. Maybe it’s the chance to build something from scratch alongside others who obsess over elegance, simplicity, and shipping quickly. Maybe it’s because you’re tired of long meetings, legacy codebases, and building features nobody asked for.
   

  

 Whatever brought you here—you’re still reading.
   

  

 At Voitto, we’re creating the world’s first AI Operating System—a system where AI agents autonomously create their own tools, orchestrate workflows, and evolve continuously. A living, breathing infrastructure designed to amplify human expertise. We need a frontend developer to make this vision powerful, intuitive, and beautifully human.
   

  

 🎨 About the Role
   

  

 This isn’t just another UI job. You’ll build schema-driven, AI-integrated, open-source-powered interfaces that feel alive—because they are. Collaborating closely with AI teams, you’ll bring real-time intelligence into thoughtful UI experiences.
   

  

**You Will**
* Build interfaces in React, using shadcn/ui, Tailwind, and modern open-source tools.
* Craft universal, schema-driven UIs—no Figma (yes, seriously).
* Integrate AI deeply into the frontend, creating responsive and intelligent interactions.
* Apply visual systems thinking—consistency, clarity, and compositional beauty.


 🧠 You’re Probably Like Us If…
   

  

* You’ve been programming since your youth—this is your craft and passion.
* You’ve built countless prototypes, even if unfinished, because you simply love creating.
* You see programming as creative expression; your code is your canvas.
* You appreciate standards—Material Design, typography, spacing—and their elegant consistency.
* You love improving upon existing solutions and sharing your enhancements openly.
* You prefer shipping quickly but neatly, always mindful of quality.
* You crave working with driven, talented people who despise pointless meetings and thrive in fast-paced environments.


 🧬 The Bigger Picture
   

  

 At Voitto, we’re not adding features—we’re fundamentally transforming how businesses operate. Our AI agents:
   

  

* Generate their own tools and integrations.
* Seamlessly orchestrate workflows across existing systems.
* Learn from interactions, adapting in real-time.
* Operate securely within your infrastructure, keeping your data yours.


 The frontend is how humans interface with this intelligence. That’s your opportunity.
   

  

 🎁 What We Offer – More Than Just a Job
   

  

* Mission with Meaning: Help shape the future of human-AI collaboration.
* Growth Opportunities: Whether early or advanced in your career, refine your skills among the best.
* Empowering Environment: Own your work, innovate freely, and receive full team support.
* Collaborative Culture: Your input matters. Learn daily alongside passionate colleagues.
* Have Fun Together: We’re genuinely excited to be here—it’s one of our most rewarding career experiences yet.


 🌍 What You’ll Get
   

  

* Stockholm office – Work from our collaborative office in Stockholm.
* Elite team – Collaborate with top-tier talent.
* No long meetings – We value deep work and asynchronous communication.
* Creative freedom – Influence meaningful UX, UI, and architecture decisions.
* Learning culture – Continuously learn and teach, raising the bar for everyone.
* Open source contributions – Actively engage with the larger developer ecosystem.


 ✨ What Makes This Special?
   

  

 You won’t be a small part in a giant machine. You’ll help build that machine—ground-up. With guidance, elite teammates, and a truly interesting product, you’ll rapidly enhance your skills, becoming a leading frontend developer in your field.
   

  

 💌 How to Apply
   

  

 We’re not looking for perfect CVs. We’re looking for passionate creators.
   

  

* Send us something you’ve built: GitHub, personal websites, or any project showcasing your abilities.
* Tell us why our mission resonates with you—or what you’d love to fix in today’s software world.
* Ever tweeted “Figma is dying, here’s why…” or been tempted to? Let’s definitely talk.

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
You are a full-stack engineer who enjoys moving between frontend and backend without friction.
   

  

 You care about the user experience as much as the data that powers it. You like turning complex information into simple, usable applications.
   

  

 You have:
   

 4–5 years building modern full-stack products.
   

 Strong experience working with Node, Express, TypeScript and React.
   

  

 Experience working Python for data tasks.
   

 Solid SQL skills and an understanding of real-world data models.
   

  

 Experience working with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP or similar.
   

  

 The ability to design features end-to-end: APIs, logic, UI, test automation, deployment.
   

  

 A habit of simplifying, reducing steps, and leaving things cleaner than you found them.
   

  

 Curiosity about user behavior and how people interact with data.
   

  

 What you’ll do
   

 In one sentence: Build the end-to-end product experience that helps users see demand, market trends and understand why it’s shifting.
   

  

 More specifically, you will:
   

 - Develop user-facing features with modern TypeScript frameworks.
   

  

 - Build and improve backend services that support dashboards, search tools, and demand metrics.
   

  

 - Shape clean, reliable APIs that power the product.
   

  

 - Work with Python and SQL to handle data transformations and prepare insights for the product.
   

  

 - Improve performance and structure across the stack.
   

  

 - Own full features from idea to shipped experience.
   

  

 - Collaborate with design and product to bring clarity to complex concepts.

title: Fullstack Javascript Developer
description:
**About Anyfin**
 At Anyfin, we believe in simplicity, transparency, and fairness. We’re the fintech on a mission to challenge the status quo, lowering interest rates, removing unnecessary fees, and helping people take control of their finances.
   

  

 With more than a million app downloads and presence in Sweden, Norway, Finland, and Germany, we’ve already helped hundreds of thousands of people save money and feel more financially empowered.
   

  

 We recently obtained our banking license, opening up an entirely new world of opportunities to provide more value to our customers, build even smarter products, scale our technology, and expand into new markets. This next chapter comes with exciting technical challenges — and we’re looking for someone who’s eager to take them on.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 As a Fullstack Developer At Anyfin, You’ll Help Build And Improve The Products That Make Finances Fairer For Our Users. You’ll Work With a Modern Tech Stack And Collaborate Closely With Designers, Product Managers, And Other Engineers To Bring Ideas To Life. You’ll
   

  

* Work across the stack, mainly using Typescript, Node.js, React, and React Native.
* Contribute to the development of new features and improvements across our backend services, web app, and mobile app.
* Collaborate with teammates on architecture decisions, code reviews, and deployment processes.
* Write clean, maintainable code and help ensure our systems stay reliable and performant.
* Be part of a team that values learning, sharing, and moving fast together.
* Balance speed with quality, because we care about building things that last and seeing our work make a real difference for our users.
* Contribute to our mission to make finances fairer and empower people to make better financial decisions.


 What we’re looking for
   

  

* Around 3+ years of professional experience working with TypeScript, both frontend and backend.
* Hands-on experience with Node.js, React and React Native (you do not need to be an expert in all three).
* Understanding of databases, API design, testing, CI/CD, and cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or similar).
* A problem-solver who takes ownership, speaks up, and helps the team and product move forward.
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment where we test, iterate, and grow quickly. Change is part of the fun.


 We offer
   

  

* A meaningful role where your work directly impacts how people experience and manage their finances.
* The chance to work alongside talented engineers, product managers, and designers with real influence on the product direction.
* A culture built on authenticity, ownership, transparency, and having fun while doing impactful work.


 Why Anyfin?
   

  

 At Anyfin, you’ll find a team driven by purpose, curiosity, and a shared ambition to make a difference. We promise a challenging and rewarding journey that will sharpen your skills, expand your creativity, and allow you to work on meaningful projects. Plus, enjoy the benefits of a centrally-located Stockholm office, competitive compensation, extra time off on your birthday, and many other perks we’ll share when we meet!
   

  

 Are you ready to help us revolutionize financial well-being for all?
   

  

 Apply today, and let’s build something amazing together. We believe that innovation thrives in person, so we work from the office four days a week to foster collaboration and creativity.
   

  

*Please note that we are not offering relocation support for this position.*
 Anyfin is a fintech on a mission to simplify loan repayments and improve the financial well-being of millions. We help consumers reduce the costs of high-interest loans, and take control of their repayment plan.

title: Ui Path Developer
description:
* Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform.
* Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.
* Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.
* Be a productive member of the team.


 Requirements
   

  

* 7–10 years of overall experience, with a minimum of 5+ years of hands-on experience in UiPath.
* 6–10 years of testing experience, including at least 3 years in RPA/UiPath testing.
* Strong competency in UiPath, supported by proven leadership and excellent communication skills.
* Lead and manage the testing team for UiPath-based automation initiatives.
* Define and implement comprehensive test strategies, plans, and test scripts for RPA workflows.
* Ensure end-to-end testing of UiPath processes, including functional, integration, and regression testing.
* Collaborate closely with developers, business analysts, and project managers to ensure timely and high-quality delivery.
* Identify, log, and track defects, ensure resolution, and uphold quality standards.
* Provide guidance on UiPath automation testing best practices and drive continuous improvement initiatives.
* Prepare and present test reports, dashboards, and quality metrics to stakeholders.
* Strong hands-on experience with UiPath Studio, Orchestrator, and Robot configuration. Solid understanding of the UiPath testing framework and the end-to-end automation lifecycle.
* Proficiency in manual and automation testing methodologies, with experience using test management and defect tracking tools such as JIRA and HP ALM.
* Good understanding of SDLC and STLC processes.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related discipline.
* UiPath certification (Advanced RPA Developer or equivalent) is preferred.
* Strong leadership and team management capabilities, excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, and a structured, analytical approach to problem-solving.


 Benefits
   

  

* A challenging, innovating environment.
* Opportunities for learning where needed.

title: Experienced Fullstack JavaScript Developer
description:
**Introduction**
 In this role you will work on various development projects focused on delivering new and updated features for players, Paradox game studios, and internal tools. You will be part of a team tasked with designing, building, and shaping the effort in realizing features which enrich our Paradox ecosystem. This also means that you will be working closely with all of the Paradox game development studios, as well as the publishing organization, in order to maximize the consumption of our services to guarantee we continue delivering Paradox signature experiences.
   

  

**Goals**
* Help the Product Owner, by providing technical expertise, in establishing, defining and ongoing refinement of the Product Roadmap.
* Collaborating with Project Manager in the successful delivery of the committed tasks
* Working with Team members, contribute to the satisfactory resolution of all Stories in the Product Backlog.
* Working with the Programming Manager, ensure that your expectations align with Paradoxes expectations and values.


**Relationships**
* The Developer will report into his/her Programming Manager
* The Developer helps the PO understand the technical requirements for completing tasks
* Consultation and collaboration in achieving the committed goals of the Team
* Synchronize on a daily basis with the Project Manager to inform on the progress of committed tasks


**Responsibilities**
 Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
   

  

* Generalized JavaScript development in frontend and backend.
* Build and maintain JavaScript services, scripts, and cloud functions
* Build and maintain internal JavaScript libraries and utilities.
* Maintain current and develop new products and/or services applicable to the Employees Team


**Qualifications**
* Experience with NodeJS.
* Experience with modern JavaScript (ES2018+).
* General understanding of best practices for data caching and writing APIs.
* General understanding of how backend APIs work (CRUD, REST, etc.).
* Test-oriented mindset with unit and/or integration tests written using standard libraries
* An understanding and practical experience of Agile methodologies.
* Service-minded
* Experience running applications on a cloud service
* Excellent English communication skills
* Experience in C++, C#, Go and/or Python is considered a merit

title: Fullstack utvecklare
description:
**Om Vimla!** 




 Är du en nyfiken fullstack-utvecklare som vill jobba i en teknikdriven miljö och göra skillnad för hundratusentals aktiva användare? Vimla är mobiloperatören, som genom att vara en fristående del av Telenor, kombinerar kraften från en stor organisation med friheten och flexibiliteten i ett litet team. Vi står för att ta kundfokus, enkelhet och schyssthet till en ny nivå på mobilmarknaden och i vårt team. Vi vill att det ska vara enkelt och roligt att vara kund så väl som medarbetare hos oss!
 



  





 Nu har du chansen att joina teamet i rollen som Senior fullstack utvecklare, ta chansen och sök!
 



  





**Vad du kommer att göra** 




 I rollen som Senior Fullstack utvecklare på Vimla kommer du in i en scale-up miljö där du tillsammans med ditt team arbetar i syfte att utveckla och underhålla Vimlas tekniska miljö. Ni står i centrum för att bygga de tekniska förutsättningarna för en helt digital mobiloperatör. Du arbetar tillsammans med ett tight team av utvecklare med passion för teknik och bra stämning. Teamet består av såväl juniora som mer seniora kollegor, vilket medför en kultur av lärande och kunskapsdelning.
 



  





 Inom ramen för rollen kommer du
 


* Bygga och optimera våra API:er
* Förbättra vår CI/CD-pipeline
* Utveckla nya tjänster i vår digitala plattform
* Jobba med skalbarhet i vår molnbaserade miljö



  





 Hos oss får du möjlighet att utmanas, utveckla din kompetens och arbeta med fantastiska och kompetenta kollegor. Om du gillar att ha en möjlighet att påverka vad du jobbar med, en bredd i dina arbetsuppgifter och jobba i ett tight DevOps-team - det här är platsen för dig!
 



  





**Vi söker dig som** 





 Vi ser att du har minst tre års tidigare erfarenheter av utveckling inom Typescript, node backends samt react för frontend. Du har fokus på leverans och säkerställer alltid god kvalitet i slutresultatet och tror att du tidigare har erfarenhet från att designa, bygga och underhålla distribuerade system i en molnbaserad miljö (tex AWS). Vi förutsätter att du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska.
 



  





 Tech-stack du jobbar med:
 


* Frontend: React, TypeScript, Redux, Jest, Playwright & React Native
* Backend: Node.js, API-utveckling
* Databas: PostgreSQL
* Arbetssätt: Agilt, DevOps, testdriven utveckling (TDD)



  





 Meriterande:
 


* Svelte
* Nginx, shell-scripting (Bash, Nushell)
* QA-arbete
* DevOps & Infrastruktur: Docker, Kubernetes/Docker Swarm, AWS, CI/CD med GitHub Actions



  





 På Vimla så värdesätter vi individer som är angelägna om att lära sig och utveckla sin egen kompetens. Vi förväntar oss inte att du känner till alla teknologier i vår stack, så vi letar främst efter någon med ett tillväxttänk och en vilja att lära sig!
 



  





**Varför du vill jobba på Vimla** 




 Vimla är på en spännande tillväxtresa och möjligheterna att växa och utvecklas tillsammans med oss är enorma. Vi är ett roligt, tight team på runt 40 personer i en egen organisation som har stor frihet. Samtidigt är Vimla en del av Telenor Sverige och använder tryggheten som finns i ett stort bolag.
 



  





**Bra att veta** 




 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Vimla/Telenor med Experis IT, som har lång erfarenhet av att rekrytera IT-specialister och chefer.
 



  





 Om du har frågor eller vill ha mer information är du välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsulterna Anki Snis på
 **anki.snis@se.experis.com** 
 , +46 70-377 59 69, och Carina Eyoma på
 **carina.eyoma@se.experis.com** 
 , +46 73-086 22 75.
 



  





 Urval sker löpande, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot att ta del av din ansökan!
 



  





 I enlighet med Telenors policy genomför vi en bakgrundskontroll på slutkandidater i alla rekryteringar.
 



  





 Plats: Stockholm Råsunda

title: Full-Stack Developer to Process & Quality | SEB, Solna
description:
Join SEB’s journey to become a data-driven bank!
   

  

 Are you ambitious, creative, and eager to grow your skills with modern technologies? SEB’s IT Asset Management team is looking for a Full-Stack Developer to help us shape the future of our applications and deliver innovative and data driven solutions.
   

  

**About Us**
 We are a dynamic, growing team that values open collaboration, continuous learning, and shared responsibility. Our culture encourages knowledge sharing through pair programming, problem-solving workshops, and ‘Demo Fridays’. You’ll work alongside both junior and senior developers, with plenty of opportunities to learn and make an impact.
   

  

**About The Role**
 You will be part of an Agile delivery team, contributing throughout the entire lifecycle—from design to production support. You will be developing line-of-business applications with a strong focus on IT Asset management, playing a key role in delivering solutions in close collaboration with stakeholders and cross-functional teams.
   

  

 As the delivery area continues to grow, you’ll have the opportunity to work across the full stack—from database modelling and back-end development to APIs, user interfaces, and integrations with other critical systems within the bank.
   

  

**Tech Stack**
* .NET, C#
* Angular, TypeScript, HTML/CSS
* REST APIs
* GitHub, CI/CD
* SQL Server
* Visual Studio Professional
* Kubernetes
* GitHub Copilot


**We Believe You Have**
* 3+ years of experience with .NET
* Frontend development experience and are familiar with Angular
* SQL Server and API development skills
* Experience with GitHub, CI/CD, and Kubernetes
* A proactive mindset and strong ownership of delivery
* A collaborative spirit and eagerness to share knowledge
* Comfort working in Agile and DevOps environments
* English fluency
* It is meritorious if you have experience with Google Cloud Platform


**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than January 13th, 2026. Due to Christmas Holidays we initiate selection process in full during the middle of January. If you have questions about the position, please contact Mikaela Sterner, Team Manager, mikaela.sterner@seb.se.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB here: http://www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

*SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.*
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Salesforce Marketing Cloud Developer
description:
Our Engagement Product Development team is growing and we are now looking for a Senior Salesforce Marketing Cloud Developer to join! Engagement at Betsson Group ensures our customers come back for more. It’s all about loyalty. We provide a world class customer experience beyond the game play featuring Tournaments, Dynamic personalized campaigns and much more!
 


**A taster of what you will be involved with** 
* Act as a consultant and technical expert on the Salesforce platform by providing support to stakeholders and users.
* Closely collaborate with experts from other areas to leverage on the Salesforce technologies through integrations with other solutions.
* Setting up new business units in SFMC that include but not limited to the configuration of the data points and FTP locations.
* Use AMP script to develop dynamic content in SFMC.
* Use SSJS to develop new custom applications in Journey Builder including leveraging the REST & SOAP APIS by creating installed packages.
* Build targeted audience segments based on email behavioral data and CRM attributes using Data Extensions and SQL Setup.
* Leveraging on the capabilities provided by Journey Builder, Automation Studio, Interaction Studio, Content Builder, Email Studio, and other solutions to deliver multi-touch communications.
* Campaigns and Triggered sends being able to oversee complex campaign workflow rules and data segmentation.
* Oversee the ETL of multiple business units that include suggesting best practices on daily automations.
* Configuring the database environment by creating the data model using data extensions and Contact Builder inside the Data Designer.
* Define data validation, cleansing, deduplication rules and processes in SFMC.
* Define data connectors for data ingestion into Salesforce across Betsson’s technical ecosystem, partnering with CRM and Data teams, as needed.
* Assist in the technical and architectural framework for the SFDC applications.
* Ensuring scalability of all the solutions developed.
* Serve as the subject matter expert for SFMC for the internal stakeholders that include managers and end-users.
* As an expert on SFMC, it is expected to gather requirements, discuss, and implement them based on best practices.
* Able to communicate technical and business solutions by developing and presenting information to multiple audiences.


**What we are looking for** 
* University degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
* Salesforce Certified Marketing Cloud Developer (or equivalent certification).
* At least 3 years of hands-on experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud.
* Strong knowledge of Salesforce administration (minimum 1 year).
* Solid understanding of SQL, data modeling, and integration methods.
* Strong documentation and knowledge-sharing mindset.
* Ability to stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and third-party solutions.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Experience with JavaScript
* Experience with Salesforce Service Cloud and Sales Cloud is a plus.


**What we offer** 

 We can offer you an environment full of ambition and passion. One day is never like the other as the only constant is change, to the better, to the greater. We strive to be the best in whatever field we choose to play on, and we make sure to have fun along the way!
 


* A friendly, open and humble working environment, where you will have the chance to work alongside with colleagues from all over the world
* A chance to evolve your skills together with your colleagues with various programs and initiatives
* Personal development through courses, in-house training and external certification



 Freedom with responsibility

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Om företaget** 




 W5 Solutions är i kraftig tillväxt för att bli den ledande globala leverantören av hållbar försvarsteknologi. Dom ligger i framkant med innovativa och banbrytande lösningar inom deras tre affärsområden Training, Power och Integration. Deras lösningar levereras till både vårt eget försvar liksom våra allierades styrkor, allt med hållbarhet och pålitlighet i fokus.
 



 W5 Solutions växer snabbt och söker nu passionerade individer till deras dynamiska team. Var med och forma framtidens försvarsteknik med ett företag som värdesätter innovation och samarbete. Vi söker nu kompetenta medarbetare till affärsområdet Integration, med placering i Solna med delade lokaler med affärsområdet Training.
 



 I rollen som Mjukvaruutvecklare har du tillsammans med ditt team en betydande del i att bolaget lyckas i denna tillväxt. Läs mer om bolaget
 **här** 
 .
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 I rollen som Mjukvaruutvecklare inom inbyggda system hos W5 får du en central och tekniskt djup roll där du arbetar med mjukvaruutveckling nära hårdvaran. Du är med i hela utvecklingskedjan – från krav, arkitektur och prototyp till verifiering och färdig produkt.
 



 Fokus i rollen ligger på utveckling av mjukvara för mikrokontroller- och Linuxbaserade system samt arbete med test- och verifieringsplattformar. Du kommer att arbeta i ett mindre utvecklingsteam med både avancerade projekt och mindre uppgifter utöver dina ordinarie arbetsuppgifter, exempelvis att gå igenom elscheman tillsammans med elektronikingenjörer, testingenjörer och olika former av kundkontakt.
 



  





**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Utveckling av mjukvara för inbyggda system baserade på MCU (främst STM32)
* Utveckling och anpassning av embedded Linux-system med hjälp av system som Buildroot, Yocto eller liknande
* Arbete med verifiering, testning och felsökning av system med mätinstrument som exempelvis oscilloskop och logikanalysator
* Aktivt deltagande i tekniska diskussioner kring arkitektur, design och teststrategier med Systemingenjör
* Teknisk dialog med kunder och leverantörer








**Kvalifikationer** 




 För att lyckas i den här rollen tror vi att du har:
 


* Ingenjörsutbildning inom exempelvis datorteknik, inbyggda system eller liknande
* Erfarenhet av embedded-utveckling i C/C++
* Erfarenhet av mikrokontrollerutveckling (STM32), kommunikationsgränssnitt, kommunikationsprotokoll och embedded Linux
* Praktisk erfarenhet av testning, verifiering och versionshantering (Git)
* Svensk medborgare då arbetet kräver säkerhetsklassning
* Flytande i tal och skrift, svenska och engelska








**Det är också meriterande om du har:** 



* Ljud- eller signalnära system
* Linux på låg nivå, FPGA eller elektroniknära arbete
* Erfarenhet av mät- och testmiljöer
* Bakgrund inom försvars- eller säkerhetsklassade projekt



  





**Viktigaste av allt så tror vi att du är:** 



* Nyfiken och noggrann
* Självgående men uppskattar samarbete
* Trivs med att ta saker hela vägen från idé till färdig lösning
* Bekväm med att ta ansvar och driva utvecklingen av mjukvara och systemlösningar
* Nyfiken och intresserad av att förstå system på djupet – både mjukvara och hårdvara



  





**Övrig information:** 




**Anställningsform:** 
 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag där du blir anställd hos A-hub men med möjlighet att bli direkt anställd hos W5 efter 12 månader.
 



**Start:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid
 



**Plats:** 
 Stockholm

title: Platform Engineer - Developer Experience
description:
**TL;DR** 
 We are seeking a Platform Engineer to enhance and scale Lovable's developer experience. In this role, you will be responsible for critical components of our stack, ensuring our engineering workflows are faster, smoother, and more
 **Lovable** 
 .
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* You have strong programming skills and a track record of improving developer velocity and system reliability.
* 7+ years of experience working in a platform team supporting developer experience (o11y, CI/CD, application frameworks, productivity tooling, etc).
* You’ve written code and tools to support growing engineering orgs in scale-ups.
* You have experience with Docker, Kubernetes and modern infrastructure practices.
* You’re a problem-solver who thrives on challenges and ships high-leverage systems fast.
* You’re comfortable navigating ambiguity and solving problems as they arise.
* You care about security, stability, and speed and know when to make trade-offs between them.
* You’re based in Stockholm or ready to relocate - this is an on-site, 5-days-a-week role.


**What You’ll Do**
**In one sentence:** 
 Own and scale the developer experience at Lovable, making our engineering teams the most productive in the world.
   

  

* Bring order and structure to our code base.
* Integrate or build application frameworks to support a growing engineering organization and code footprint
* Own and develop our observability stack, from code instrumentation through ingestion to presentation.
* Integrating tools for AI driven development.
* Identify and drive reliability improvement efforts across all engineering teams.


**Our tech stack**
 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love. Lovable platform engineers are capable of working across the whole stack. Examples of tech in our stack include:
   

  

* Frontend: React and Typescript.
* Backend: Golang and Rust.
* Cloud: Cloudflare, GCP, AWS, Modal.
* Data: Clickhouse, Firestore, Spanner, BigQuery.
* DevOps Tooling: CI/CD pipelines, OTEL, Grafana, kubernetes, terraform.
* Local Tooling: Nix, DevEnv.


 And always on the lookout for what's next!
   

  

**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English - it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal

title: Linux Engineer – Shape the Future with Code
description:
Voitto – Where code becomes intelligence, and infrastructure learns to think.
   

  

 At
 **Voitto** 
 , we’re not building just another Linux distro or fancy shell. We’re building a self-learning, AI-driven operating system—a foundation where specialized AI agents collaborate, create tools, automate workflows, and evolve with you. Think of it as a living system that understands your infrastructure, respects your stack, and makes your business run ten times more efficiently.
   

  

 This isn’t just about automating tasks—it’s about transforming how work gets done.
   

  

 We’re looking for a Linux Engineer who lives and breathes systems. Someone who’s passionate about simplicity, open source, and hacking smarter—not harder. Someone who knows the command line is still the most powerful UI ever built, and that beneath every flashy tool is a well-behaved process.
   

  

 🧠 About You – The Linux Purist with AI Curiosity
   

  

**Curious Explorer:** 
 You’ve probably installed more distros than you can remember. You know why Alpine exists, and you’ve got Opinions™ about init systems. You’re deeply curious and love dissecting how things work at the OS level.
   

  

**Prototype Builder:** 
 Your GitHub is a museum of cool side projects—some rough, some polished, all driven by curiosity. You build because it’s fun, and you learn by getting your hands dirty.
   

  

**Simplicity Seeker:** 
 You believe in the Unix philosophy and admire tools that do one thing well. When you spot complexity, your instinct is to refactor it away.
   

  

**AI-Powered Engineer:** 
 You’ve embraced AI tools not as gimmicks, but as powerful collaborators. You move faster, explore deeper, and think bigger because you know how to prompt, test, and integrate AI into your workflow.
   

  

**Initiative Taker:** 
 You don’t wait for specs—you define them. You think in systems and build with intent. You prefer launching imperfect solutions over endlessly planning perfect ones.
   

  

**Mission-Driven Teammate:** 
 You want to work on something that matters—with people who care. You’ve got a passion for elegant systems and a distaste for bureaucracy.
   

  

 🧬 Our Mission
   

  

 At Voitto, we’re building the
 **world’s first true AI Operating System** 
 —a platform where:
   

  

* AI agents build their own tools, connectors, and flows
* Complex business logic is orchestrated automatically
* The system learns from how you work, not the other way around
* Everything runs securely on your own infrastructure, respecting your stack
* Human expertise is preserved and extended—not replaced


 We’re creating an OS that starts as an
 **empty canvas** 
 , learns from your environment, and evolves into a system that fits you like a glove.
   

  

 🛠 Your Role – Let’s Build Smarter Infrastructure Together
   

  

**System Architecture:** 
 Help shape and evolve the core infrastructure of Voitto—from process orchestration to service management to secure agent execution.
   

  

**Service Creation:** 
 Build new services and foundational components that will power our AI agents and automation layer.
   

  

**Low-Level Wizardry:** 
 Work close to the metal, from kernel configs to network tuning, helping ensure the OS layer is fast, secure, and rock-solid.
   

  

**Tooling and Automation:** 
 Help us automate everything—because the best shell script is the one that writes itself (or gets written by AI).
   

  

**AI-Native Integration:** 
 Collaborate with our AI team to ensure the system can be introspected, monitored, and controlled by intelligent agents.
   

  

 🌍 What We Offer – Why Join Us?
   

  

* Stockholm office – Work from our office in Stockholm, with flexible arrangements
* No meetings culture – We believe in deep work, async comms, and smart people not needing constant oversight
* Elite team – Work with developers who care deeply about quality, and are at the top of their game
* Open source mindset – Build with, and for, the community. We don’t gatekeep knowledge—we share it
* Work with AI, not around it – Be part of a system that puts AI where it belongs: everywhere


 ✨ Why This Isn’t “Just Another Job”
   

  

 Because you’re not just maintaining systems—you’re
 **inventing the next layer of computing** 
 . You’re helping build a platform that learns and adapts to its environment. You’re joining a team that codes because it’s fun and fulfilling. You’re entering a space where
 *one developer with AI* 
 can do what used to take a whole team.
   

  

 If that excites you, we’re probably already aligned.
   

  

 🚀 How to Apply
   

  

* Share your GitHub, blog, dotfiles, scripts, projects—anything that shows what you’ve built and what you care about
* Tell us what you’re passionate about, and what you’d love to build with us


**Voitto – AI Operating System that builds itself.**
 We’re not a product. We’re a platform for transformation.
   

  

 No recruiters. No fluff. Just passionate people building the future.

title: Project Manager - Component
description:
Are you an adaptable and structured project manager who thrives on bringing clarity to complex technical challenges?
   

  

 At Blykalla, we’re seeking a Project Manager to lead the industrialization and validation of our reactor components. You’ll coordinate work across engineering, manufacturing and suppliers, ensuring that plans are clear, progress is transparent and results are delivered.
   

  

**What We Do At Blykalla**
*Blykalla is developing the next generation of nuclear technology with our Small Modular Reactor (SMR) based on innovative fuel, materials, and reactor designs. As Sweden’s only SMR developer, we are on a mission to decarbonize industries and enable safe, scalable, and sustainable energy solutions. Our technology uses uranium nitride fuel and lead coolant, creating novel challenges and opportunities for the fuel cycle and supporting systems.*
**What You’ll Get To Do**
 As a Project Manager at Blykalla, you’ll coordinate and steer projects focused on developing, testing, and industrializing core reactor components. You’ll ensure that the work moves forward efficiently, with clear structures and communication between internal teams and external partners.
   

  

 Your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Coordinating activities and steering the engineering team in the right direction.
* Maintaining and updating the Project Charter and Project Management Plan (PMP).
* Managing resources, timelines, and deliverables, and reporting progress and risks to the Business Review Meetings (BRM) and project sponsor.
* Balancing technical input from design, manufacturing partners, and materials development.
* Mitigating risks, solving blockers, and ensuring projects stay on schedule.
* Supporting test rig planning, equipment commissioning, and validation efforts.
* Ensuring structured communication, documentation, and follow-up across all stakeholders.
* Engaging with technical details when needed to ensure progress and resolve challenges.


**Who You Are**
 You are a hands-on, technically minded project manager who enjoys bringing structure to complex work and driving results. You’re comfortable coordinating across engineering and suppliers, and you thrive in a setting where clarity and progress matter.
   

  

 We believe you have:
   

  

* A degree in engineering or equivalent technical background.
* 5+ years of experience in project management within component or hardware development.
* Strong experience in stakeholder management and communication.
* A proven track record of commissioning equipment and delivering technical projects to completion.
* A proactive, solution-oriented “get things done” attitude.
* Fluency in English; Swedish is a plus.


 Nice to have:
   

  

* Experience from testing, qualification, or validation projects.
* Familiarity with supplier management or nuclear industry environments.


**Location**
 This position is for our office in Stockholm.
   

  

 So, what do you think?
   

  

 Joining our team means being part of a supportive and innovative environment where your ideas are valued and your expertise is recognized.
   

  

 You will have the opportunity to work with industry leaders and contribute to the safe and sustainable use of nuclear power.
   

  

 If you are ready to take on this exciting challenge and contribute to the future of clean energy, we would love to hear from you!
   

  

*Note: We do not offer relocation for this position.*

title: Security Engineer - Detection and Response
description:
The Spotify Security team is looking to advance our threat detection and incident response capabilities. If working with logs and security telemetry to identify new and unknown threats excites you, if you are excited about building detection infrastructure and security automation at scale, and if you are up to the challenge of managing security incidents and driving enterprise-wide efforts for containment and response, then stop what you’re doing and apply!
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Work with our IT, infrastructure, and feature teams across Spotify to identify new detection opportunities and build out the signal collection to support it.
* Determine the best solutions for monitoring, processing, and alerting on security-based signals.
* Form repeatable processes for prioritizing and responding to alerts and developing playbooks.
* Mature our capabilities to proactively identify security threats and develop detections.
* Participate in response to incidents to drive containment and remediation to keep Spotify secure.
* Work with security technologies such as SIEM, EDR, SOAR and other platforms that we use in our daily operations.
* Use powerful AI tools to automate, accelerate and scale our engineering capabilities.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have experience and interest in security detection engineering and incident response.
* You have a proven understanding of developer concepts and technologies such as Github, CI/CD, and infrastructure as code.
* You like crafting repeatable processes, but when you have to do something more than a few times, you automate it using a scripting language of your choice, or an automation platform.
* You have an understanding of the current threat landscape and building detection and response capabilities in SaaS-oriented corporate IT environments.
* You have experience working in cloud environments such as GCP, AWS, or Azure.
* You are excited about using generative AI to build the next generation of triage and response tooling.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London (UK) or Stockholm (Sweden).
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Solutions Architect
description:
**TL;DR -** 
 We’re looking for a Solutions Architect to bridge product depth with business outcomes at Lovable. You’ll help customers understand how Lovable fits into their architecture, design solutions that win enterprise trust, and partner with Sales, Product, and Engineering to drive adoption of AI-native software creation.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with any language. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* Experience in solutions architecture or sales engineering at a high-growth startup
* Deep understanding of technical architectures, APIs, integrations, data flows, and cloud infrastructure
* Strong consultative selling skills – able to map product capabilities to customer pain points and ROI
* Skilled at communicating complex technical concepts simply to both engineering and executive audiences
* Builder mindset – you enjoy creating scalable processes, proof-of-concepts, and reusable frameworks
* Collaborative partner to Sales, Product, and Engineering, ensuring tight feedback loops

**What You’ll Do**

* Architect Lovable solutions that align with customer goals and technical constraints
* Develop repeatable frameworks for demos, proofs-of-value, and implementation design
