title: UI/UX designer
description:
### **Role Description**


We are looking for a UI/UX Designer for an assignment within digital development at a leading financial institution. The assignment is part of an early-stage transformation focused on expanding digital services for private and high-net-worth clients. The role involves close collaboration between business and technology, where you will play an important part in shaping the user experience of the organisation’s digital offerings.

### **Responsibilities**


In the role as UI/UX Designer, you will work with designing and refining user interfaces and user experiences for digital banking services. This includes working with user research, user flows, and high-fidelity prototypes. You will collaborate closely with a UX Lead, product owners, developers, and other designers in an agile environment. The role also involves ensuring consistency, accessibility, and alignment with the organisation’s design system across digital channels. Design work is carried out iteratively, with continuous feedback, testing, and improvements based on user insights.

### **Requirements**

* Senior-level UI/UX design skills with a clear focus on UI
* At least 5 years of experience designing interfaces for web, mobile, and applications
* High proficiency in Figma
* Strong sense of ownership with a problem-solving and hands-on mindset
* Education in human–computer interaction and design, or equivalent professional experience
* Fluency in English

### **Start / Duration**

**Start:** 2026-01-01  

**Duration:** 12 months

### **Location**


Stockholm (hybrid, 3 days per week onsite)

### **About Rasulson Consulting**


Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm within the IT sector. We partner with established technology companies as well as innovative startups to offer attractive career opportunities for professionals looking to grow within digital development and IT. With our strong technical expertise and extensive network, we effectively match the right consultant with the right assignment. At Rasulson Consulting, you will receive personalized guidance, ongoing feedback, and the opportunity to take the next step in your career.

title: Interior Lighting Designer
description:
**We are looking for an Interior Lighting Designer for a company in Gothenburg. Start is in February, 5 months limited contract to begin with.**

**Assignment Overview**  

A visionary Creative Lighting Designer to help shape the next chapter of in-car experiences. From subtle moods to expressive interactive moments, you will turn light into emotion, character, and storytelling—crafting the visual language that drivers feel as much as they see. You'll collaborate closely with Interior Design, CMF, UX, and Engineering to imagine, prototype, and bring to life lighting innovations that push boundaries while meeting real-world performance and regulatory needs.

 **About the Role:**  

As a Creative Lighting Designer, you will define the interior lighting vision for vehicle designing ambient, functional, and communicative lighting that seamlessly blends aesthetics, technology, and brand DNA. Your work will merge artistry with engineering, transforming raw ideas into simulations, prototypes, and production feasible solutions.

**What You'll Bring**  

A bachelor's degree (or higher) in Industrial/Product/Transportation Design, Interaction/Lighting Design, or a related field. Real-world experience in automotive, architectural, or consumer lighting, backed by a portfolio that shows both imagination and execution. Flexible tool pipeline such as Photoshop, Blender, and Adobe Creative Suite for concepting and visualization. A track record of turning lighting concepts into manufacturable, engineering-aligned solutions. Excellent communication and presentation skills—your storytelling shines through both visuals and words. A maker mindset: hands-on prototyping skills, basic electronics knowledge, and curiosity to explore. Familiarity with automotive lighting regulations and constraints (a major plus). A creative, fast-thinking, problem-solving approach that thrives in a high-energy studio environment. Bonus: Interest or experience with other digital pipelines (e.g., Grasshopper).

**What You'll Do**:  

Design interior lighting concepts spanning ambient, functional, and communicative use cases. Propose innovative integrations of light into surfaces, materials, and architectural forms. Convert brand DNA into distinctive lighting signatures and dynamic behaviors (welcome/farewell actions, charging animations, thematic moods, ADAS signals). Validate feasibility through visualization, simulation, and VR tools. Create compelling presentations and prototypes that bring stakeholders and suppliers along the journey.

 **Nice to Have**:  

Experience with cutting-edge lighting technologies such as OLEDs, projection/DLP, AR overlays, and interactive surfaces. Knowledge of optics, light guides, interior human-factors, luminance planning, and glare management. Previous work in automotive design studios or with Tier-1 suppliers. Expertise in material-light interaction in interiors.

**Additional Details:**  

Occasional travel to China may be required. A valid driver's license is preferred.

 **This role requires fluency in English, both written and spoken.**


This is a full-time consultant position in Gothenburg through Incluso. Start is in February, 5 months limited contract to begin with, with possibility of extension after that. This role is 100% onsite in Gothenburg.  

  

Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis. **Please note! All CV’s must be in English.**


For more information about this role, please contact Emma Hörnstenrecruiter at Incluso.

title: Erfaren UX-designer till långsiktigt uppdrag inom digitala tjänster
description:
**Om uppdraget**  

Vi söker en erfaren och prestigelös UX-designer för ett långsiktigt konsultuppdrag inom digitala tjänster för mobil och webb . Du blir en del av ett tvärfunktionellt, agilt team och arbetar nära användare, verksamhet och utveckling för att skapa tillgängliga och användarvänliga lösningar som gör verklig skillnad i människors vardag.


Rollen passar dig som trivs med samarbete, dialog och kontinuerlig förbättring. Du arbetar användarnära genom hela designprocessen och är van att omsätta komplexa behov till fungerande och inkluderande UX. Fokus ligger på bokningsflöden och tjänster riktade till användare med särskilda behov, såsom personer med funktionsnedsättningar och äldre med låg digital vana .

**Arbetsuppgifter**  

Arbeta genom hela UX-processen från research och användarinsikter till detaljdesign och uppföljning  

Ha löpande dialog med användare, intressenter och team kring behov och lösningar  

Driva förbättringar av befintliga digitala tjänster samt bidra i nyutveckling  

Samarbeta tätt med UX/UI-designers, copywriters och utvecklare  

Bidra aktivt i diskussioner om design, tillgänglighet och användarupplevelse  

Arbeta med design för både app och webbtjänster, inklusive boknings- och kundserviceflöden

**Kravprofil**  

Dokumenterad erfarenhet av UX-design för bokning och hantering av anropsstyrda eller komplexa flöden  

Vana att arbeta genom hela designprocessen, från research till färdig design  

Erfarenhet av att arbeta användarnära och basera UX-beslut på verkliga behov  

Mycket god kunskap om tillgänglighet, WCAG och gällande lagstiftning inom området  

Erfarenhet av att förbättra befintlig UX samt arbeta med nyutveckling  

Strukturerat arbetssätt och förmåga att kommunicera idéer tydligt
  

Erfarenhet av Jira samt designverktyg som Figma, Sketch, Adobe CC, XD, Maze och After Effects  

Erfarenhet av design för flera plattformar: iOS, Android och webb  

Erfarenhet av design kopplat till kundservice  

Erfarenhet från mobilitet, kollektivtrafik eller liknande samhällsnära tjänster  

Universitetsutbildning om minst tre år inom relevant designområde  

Masterutbildning är meriterande

**Praktisk information**  

Uppdragets omfattning motsvarar 80 % av heltid  

Uppdragsperiod 7 januari 2026 till 31 december 2026  

Arbetet sker i hybridformat med fasta kontorsdagar tillsammans med teamet  

Arbetstid vardagar dagtid


Detta är ett meningsfullt uppdrag där du får arbeta med digitala tjänster som används dagligen och bidrar till mer tillgängliga, inkluderande och friktionsfria upplevelser för många människor


Sway Sourcing är en innovativ rekryteringspartner som specialiserar sig på att matcha rätt talang med rätt företag – snabbt och effektivt. Vårt huvudfokus ligger inom Ekonomi, Administration, HR, Marknad och IT, men vi har även den breda expertis och flexibilitet som krävs för att leverera skräddarsydda rekryteringslösningar inom alla branscher.


Trots att vi är en relativt ny aktör har vi redan byggt förtroende hos många av Sveriges största företag och arbetar både nationellt och internationellt. Med baser i Sverige och Spanien erbjuder vi en unik kombination av lokal expertis och global räckvidd. Vårt starka nätverk och djupa branschinsikter gör oss till en självklar partner för företag som vill ligga steget före i sin rekrytering.

title: Senior UI/UX Designer – Stockholm
description:
We are looking for a senior UI/UX Designer for a consulting assignment within digital banking.


The assignment is part of an early-stage digital transformation aimed at enhancing digital services for private and high-net-worth clients You will have a central role in shaping modern, intuitive, and accessible digital experiences in close collaboration with both business and technology teams.


As a designer, you will work hands-on with the UI and UX of digital banking services, from early concepts to high-fidelity prototypes. Your work will be grounded in user research, insights, and testing, ensuring solutions that create real user value


You will collaborate closely with a UX Lead, product owners, developers, and other designers in an agile setup. A key part of the assignment is to ensure consistency, accessibility, and alignment with the existing design system across all digital channels


**Required experience and skills**

* Senior UI/UX design skills with a strong focus on UI
* At least 5 years of experience designing interfaces for web, mobile, and apps
* Strong sense of ownership with a proactive and problem-solving mindset
* Hands-on approach and ability to take designs from idea to execution
* Education in human–computer interaction, design, or equivalent professional experience
* High proficiency in Figma
* Fluent in English, Swedish is a plus


You value research and insights as the foundation for strong design decisions
  

You believe in continuous iteration to build intuitive and user-friendly products  

Comfortable leading and participating in user research, feedback sessions, and usability testing  

Enjoy working in collaborative teams and adapting to evolving needs to improve the customer experience


**Assignment Details**

**Location:** Stockholm

**Allocation:** 100%, Full-time

**Remote Work:** Hybrid, 3 days per week onsite

**End date:** 2026-12-31


Sway Sourcing is an innovative recruitment partner specializing in matching the right talent with the right company—quickly and efficiently. Our strong network and deep industry insights make us the obvious partner for companies looking to stay ahead in their recruitment efforts.

title: Interior Lighting Designer Göteborg
description:
**Om uppdraget**
----------------

Vi söker en visionär **Interior Creative Lighting Designer** som vill vara med och forma nästa generation av upplevelser i fordonets interiör. I denna roll blir du central i designstudion och arbetar nära Interior Design, CMF, UX och Engineering för att skapa ljuslösningar som inte bara syns – utan känns. Du designar allt från subtila stämningar till dynamiska, kommunikativa ljussekvenser och omvandlar ljus till emotion, identitet och storytelling. Arbetet spänner över hela kedjan från idé och koncept via simuleringar och prototyper till produktionsnära lösningar som uppfyller tekniska och regulatoriska krav.

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
------------------------

Du kommer att:


Skapa interiöra ljuskoncept som täcker ambient, funktionell och kommunikativ belysning, där estetik, teknik och varumärkes-DNA flätas samman.


Omvandla designvisioner till visuella koncept, digitala simuleringar och prototyper i verktyg som Photoshop, Blender och övriga kreativa plattformar.


Föra en tät dialog med UX, CMF och Engineering för att säkerställa att ljuslösningarna är genomförbara, tekniskt robusta och följer lagkrav och interna riktlinjer.


Utveckla distinkta ljussignaturer och dynamiska beteenden såsom welcome/farewell-sekvenser, tematiska moods, ADAS-relaterad kommunikation och charging animations.


Utföra visualisering, simulering och VR-baserad validering av koncept för att säkerställa designkvalitet och teknisk feasibility.


Skapa presentationer och prototyper som engagerar och guidar både stakeholders och leverantörer genom utvecklingsprocessen.


Utforska och föreslå innovativa ljusintegrationer i material, ytor och arkitektoniska former.


Delta i benchmarking, tech scouting och workshops med externa partners och innovationsbolag inom ljusområdet.


**Förväntade leveranser**
-------------------------

Högkvalitativa ljuskoncept för interiör – från mood lighting till funktionella och kommunikativa ljusflöden.


Distinkta ljussignaturer och ljusstrategier kopplade till varumärkesidentitet.


Visualiseringar, simuleringar och prototyper som stödjer beslut och vidareutveckling.


Feasibility-analyser samt dokumentation av kravtolkningar och tekniska förutsättningar.


Underlag till leverantörer, prototypframtagning och valideringstester.

**Din profil**
--------------

Du har en kandidatexamen eller högre inom Industrial/Product/Transportation Design, Interaction/Lighting Design eller liknande.


Du har erfarenhet av kreativ ljusdesign inom automotive, arkitektur eller consumer lighting och kan visa upp en portefölj som förenar visionärt tänkande med praktisk genomförbarhet.


Du behärskar verktyg såsom Photoshop, Blender och Adobe Creative Suite och har förmåga att snabbt visualisera idéer.


Du har en förståelse för hur ljuskoncept omsätts i tekniskt realiserbara lösningar och hur estetik möter engineering.


Du är van att kommunicera tydligt, presentera dina idéer och bygga storytelling kring ljusupplevelser.


Du har en maker-mindset med vilja att skapa prototyper, testa och experimentera – gärna med viss elektronikvana.

### **Meriterande:**


Kunskap om automotive-regler inom ljus, optik, ljusleder, material-ljus-interaktion, AR-overlays, Grasshopper och avancerade ljusteknologier som OLED och projektion/DLP.


Flytande engelska i tal och skrift är ett krav. Körkort är meriterande.

**Personliga egenskaper**
-------------------------

Kreativ och snabbfotad med förmåga att ta idéer från skiss till prototyp.


Strukturerad, leveranssäker och trygg i att arbeta både självständigt och tvärfunktionellt.


Nyfiken, lösningsorienterad och trivs i en dynamisk studiokultur med högt tempo.


Utmärkt kommunikatör som skapar engagemang kring dina koncept och idéer.

**Plats:** Göteborg  

**Omfattning:** Heltid  

**Period:** 2 feb 2026 – 31 jul 2026  

**Sista ansökningsdag:** 22 december


Sway Sourcing är en innovativ rekryteringspartner som specialiserar sig på att matcha rätt talang med rätt företag – snabbt och effektivt. Vårt huvudfokus ligger inom Ekonomi, Administration, HR, Marknad och IT, men vi har även den breda expertis och flexibilitet som krävs för att leverera skräddarsydda rekryteringslösningar inom alla branscher.


Trots att vi är en relativt ny aktör har vi redan byggt förtroende hos många av Sveriges största företag och arbetar både nationellt och internationellt. Med baser i Sverige och Spanien erbjuder vi en unik kombination av lokal expertis och global räckvidd. Vårt starka nätverk och djupa branschinsikter gör oss till en självklar partner för företag som vill ligga steget före i sin rekrytering.

title: Digital Analyst
description:
* Application Deadline: Jan. 10, 2026
* Kista
* Hybrid
**Job Description**
-------------------

*As a Digital Analyst at Tele2 B2B, you turn data into direction. You’ll shape smarter digital journeys for our customers and partners by transforming insights into actions that boost engagement, drive conversions, and elevate our entire digital ecosystem. If you’re excited by the idea of combining analytics, business impact, and real customer value — this is the role for you.*  

  

At Tele2 B2B (Business to business), we work every day to provide a society of unlimited possibilities through our broad portfolio of IT- and Telecom related Products and Services. With a team of knowledgeable
  

experts, we help Private and Public customers digitalize and secure their business potential. We are now looking for a new member to join our successful team and contribute to our growth, superior customer experience, and high employee engagement.


**About the job**  

As a Digital Analyst in our B2B Digital team, you play a key role in shaping how our customers and partners experience Tele2 across all digital touchpoints. You will work at the intersection of data, customer experience, and commercial growth- ensuring that decisions are insight-driven and that our digital channels continuously evolve in the right direction.



You will collaborate closely with colleagues from Marketing, Product, Commercial, and Development teams to understand performance, user behavior, and business needs. Your insights will guide priorities, inspire improvements, and support our mission to deliver a superior digital experience for our customers and partners.


**In this role you will:**


* Lead KPI tracking and performance reporting across key digital channels
* Build dashboards and automate reporting to support decision-making
* Analyze customer behavior, user journeys, surveys, and qualitative insights
* Identify opportunities and problem areas through funnel analysis and UX data
* Drive CRO initiatives, including A/B testing, hypotheses, conversion analysis, and structured optimization
* Translate data into clear, actionable recommendations for teams and stakeholders


**Who are you?**  

To thrive in this role, we believe you have a minimum of five years’ experience working in digital analytics, using data to understand user behavior and optimize digital performance. You are skilled at transforming complex data into clear insights and actionable recommendations that drive measurable impact.



You are confident in your role, comfortable taking ownership, and naturally proactive — you don’t wait for tasks, you take initiative and push improvements forward. You collaborate well with cross-functional teams and communicate insights in a way that engages both team members and stakeholders.


*Must-haves:*


* Solid experience working with GA4
* Strong skills in Looker Studio
* Experience with Contentsquare or similar qualitative user-behavior tools
* Good knowledge of CRO and experience with A/B testing tools


*Nice-to-haves:*


* Basic knowledge of Google Tag Manager
* Experience with BigQuery
* Experience working in B2B environments
**Great Place to Work**
-----------------------

* Pension and health care
* Hybrid and flexible work life balance
* Career opportunities
* Parental benefit
* Employee benefits and Tele2 discounts
* Inclusive workplace
**Skills & Requirements**
-------------------------

**A few words from the manager**  

*Hi, I’m Nina Aschan, Manager B2B Digital at Tele2. In our B2B Digital team, we combine expertise, curiosity, and collaboration to build smarter digital experiences for our customers and partners. We work hand-on, we help each other grow, and we value people who take initiative and bring new ideas to the table. If you want to make real impact through insights and enjoy being part of a supportive, forward-thinking team - this is the role for you.*


**Why Tele2**  

We believe in fostering a creative and flexible work environment. You will be part of a culture where teamwork and inclusion are leading the way forward, a place where you bring your whole self to work as the unique person you are. We are committed to building a company that values diversity in all its forms.



Every employee is important for the company’s success, and you will always have an impact through your work with opportunities for growth and development through internal paths.



At Tele2, we work hard to our commitment to lead in sustainability, which has made us a climate leader in Europe according to Financial Times. Sweden’s most sustainable company and ranked 37th globally by Time Magazine and Statista on their inaugural World’s Most Sustainable Companies list, featuring 500 companies from more than 30 countries. We keep reaching new goals as we are bound to shift to a circular economy.


**Interest and application**  

Would you like to be a part of the Tele2s value-driven and including culture? Then hit the “apply now” button and let’s find out if we’re a match!



If you have any specific questions regarding the position, please feel free to contact TA specialist: [email protected]



Please note that in compliance with personal data management regulations (GDPR), we are unable to accept CVs via email.
  

  

Warmly welcome to submit your application! To ensure an inclusive and fair recruitment process, we focus on your experiences and skills. Therefore, Tele2 has chosen not to consider cover letters. Instead, we kindly ask you to answer the screening questions included in the application form.


*As a step in the recruitment process, Tele2 performs a background check on final candidates.*


**Work with great people**
--------------------------

Emma
Digital Capabilities & Technology
*"Everyone at Tele2 always aim for the stars in order to create unlimited possibilities."*
Fanny
Systemspecialist Unified Communications
*"The work environment at Tele2 supports both personal and professional development, and there are significant opportunities for further career advancement"*
**About the company**
---------------------

At Tele2 we work hard to fulfill our commitment to lead in sustainability, being named a climate leader in Europe by The Financial Times. Sweden’s most sustainable company and ranked 37th globally by Time Magazine and Statista on their inaugural World’s Most Sustainable Companies list, featuring 500 companies from more than 30 countries. We keep reaching new goals as we are bound to shift to a circular economy, and we help our customers to do this too.


Our Values; Be Brave, Take Action, Make it Simple and Act Cost-efficient.

title: UX/UI Designer Intern
description:
**About XR Solutions** 




 XR Solutions is a technology-driven company pioneering machine learning-powered augmented reality solutions for industrial clients.
 



 Our mission is to revolutionize how machines are operated, maintained, and optimized — enabling workflows and innovations that were once impossible. We combine research-based optimizations with cutting-edge AR technology to create practical, reliable, and high-performance solutions that reshape industries.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We are seeking a passionate and dedicated
 **UX/UI Designer** 
 to join our team for an 6-month Internship. This is an exciting opportunity for someone looking to gain hands-on experience in Design, Marketing and XR within a fast-paced and supportive environment.
 



  





**You will among other things be work with:** 



* Participate in all stages of the design process: research, workshops, ideation, prototyping, and delivery.
* Create user journeys, sketches, wireframes, and interactive prototypes based on insights.
* Work with Figma and other design tools for XR experiences.
* Conduct user interviews, workshops, and product testing.
* Design interfaces for XR headsets, including interaction methods (hand tracking, eye tracking, etc.).



  





**To succeed in this role, you should have** 



* Previous of relevant work experience in
 **UX/UI** 
 and
 **XR Design** 
 (
 **Meritorious)**
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.
* Self-driven, Detail-oriented, structured way of working.
* Ability to choose and adapt methods/tools to the situation.
* User-focused mindset and passion for solving real problems.
* Proficiency in
 **Figma** 
 .
* Curiosity and openness to new tools and workflows.



  





**What we offer** 



* Practical experience in AR/XR product development.
* The chance to make real impact in a growing startup.
* Remote-friendly setup and flexible workspaces.
* Strategic involvement and contribution to a product launch.



  





 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in backend development.

title: Product Designer
description:
**TL;DR** 
 - We’re looking for world-class product designers to help shape Lovable. You’ll lead projects end-to-end, collaborating closely with engineering. We expect a broad range of design skills, and exceptional taste. You’ll join a team at the forefront of AI, enabling anyone to create software.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* A track record of working in high performing, fast-paced startup environments
* A portfolio showcasing successful product work loved by users and produced in high-velocity teams
* Talent for simplifying complicated user journeys into intuitive experiences
* Strong prototyping abilities with emphasis on clear visual communication
* Fluency with design systems and technical implementations
* Outstanding command of visual design, UI patterns, and interaction principles
* High aptitude for shipping and learning extraordinarily quickly
* Bonus: You ship to production, perhaps with a little help from AI
* Bonus: Experience designing AI products


**What You’ll Do**
**In one sentence:** 
 Design Lovable, making it the most Lovable piece of software ever.
   

  

* Craft detailed user flows and high-fidelity mockups for new features
* Own design projects from conception to delivery, collaborating with engineering or ideally implementing yourself with AI (we'll train you)
* Be scrappy and hands on with any design assets needed
* Establish scalable design processes that uphold quality standards
* Champion quick wins and impactful improvements
* Contribute to improving the design quality of Lovable's AI
* Help set the bar for design quality and the culture for how design works at Lovable


**How We Hire**
* Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call.
* We'll send you a quick take-home asking to present your best work over a loom video presentation.
* Join us for a round of interviews to discuss your experience in more depth
* Join us for trial work lasting 1-2 days remote or on-site. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team and explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you.


**Important Note** 
 :
   

  

* Please submit your application in English. It’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal.

title: UX Researcher
description:
**TL;DR –** 
 We’re looking for a curious, fast-moving UX Researcher to help shape the future of Lovable. You’ll uncover how users think, feel, and act, turning insights into product direction. You’ll design studies, test concepts, and experiment with new AI-assisted ways of learning from users, helping us move fast without compromising on craft.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products — fast. We are at the forefront of a fundamental shift in how software is created: from code-first to intelligence-first.
   

  

 Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate workflows, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We operate with high ownership, high velocity, and low-ego collaboration. We care deeply, move fast, and are here to build something that outlives us.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
 We’re looking for a researcher who balances
 **curiosity and rigor** 
 — someone who loves asking
 *why* 
 , tests
 *how* 
 , and measures
 *what’s working* 
 . You’re as comfortable in a user interview as you are interpreting event data or survey results, and you know how to connect human stories with product metrics.
   

  

* 3–6 years of experience in UX research, human-centered design, or a related role.
* Proficiency in qualitative methods (interviews, usability testing, concept testing).
* Experience with survey design, data analysis, and working with behavioral data (e.g., from analytics tools) is a plus
* Strong synthesis skills, distilling findings into insights that influence design and product decisions.
* Excellent communication and storytelling skills to bring research to life for cross-functional teams.
* Comfortable in fast-paced, iterative environments with shifting priorities.
* Experience working closely with designers, PMs, and data scientists.


**What You’ll Do**
 In one sentence:
   

  

**Turn user insights into product direction that shapes how the world builds software.**
* Partner with product, design, growth and data teams to define learning goals for upcoming features and experiments.
* Explore new AI-driven approaches for recruiting, analysis, and synthesis — expanding how we learn from users.
* Conduct user sessions directly with Lovable users, gathering firsthand insights into behaviors, motivations, and unmet needs.
* Collaborate with data scientists to interpret behavioral data and validate qualitative findings.
* Contribute to building research frameworks, templates, and best practices for scalable discovery at Lovable.


**How We Hire**
* Fill out a short form and hop on a quick intro call with our recruiting team
* Meet designers and PMs to discuss your approach to research
* Walk through past work and real examples of your process
* Final conversations with product leadership


**About Your Application**
 Please submit your application in English — it’s our company language.
   

  

 We treat all candidates equally, so please apply through our careers portal.

title: Product Manager Intern
description:
**Description**
 THIS ROLE IS OPEN TO STUDENTS GRADUATING IN 2026 or 2027 SEEKING AN INTERNSHIP WITH A START DATE FROM JANUARY - JULY 2026. IF THIS MATCHES YOUR EXPECTED GRADUATION DATE AND AVAILABILITY, PLEASE CONTINUE READING.
   

  

 At Amazon, we are working to be the most customer-centric company on earth.
   

  

 Amazon is looking for passionate, versatile, and curious Product Manager Interns to join our teams across various business units. You will work on product innovation and improvement initiatives that directly impact our customers and drive business growth worldwide.
   

  

 As a Product Manager Intern at Amazon, you'll dive into a dynamic environment that empowers you to solve complex challenges, develop products, and make a meaningful impact across diverse business units.
   

  

 Note: You must have the right to work in the country of employment by the start date.
   

  

 Key Learning Objectives
   

  

**The Role Emphasizes Development In These Core Competencies**
* Customer-Centric Product Thinking: gain exposure to customer research methods and learn how Amazon identifies customer pain points.
* Product Strategy: understand how product roadmaps are created and participate in prioritization discussions.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: observe how teams work together and practice communication skills with guidance.
* Data-Driven Decision Making: learn basic product metrics and how to interpret data to inform product decisions.
* Market Analysis: assist with competitive research and understand how Amazon positions products.
* Development Process: experience agile methodologies through observation and participation in team ceremonies.
* Go-to-Market Approach: gain exposure to product launch processes and understand team collaboration.


 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* You will collaborate with engineering, design, and business teams to develop comprehensive product strategies.
* You will conduct in-depth customer research and market analysis to identify emerging opportunities.
* You will define and prioritize product requirements using data-driven insights.
* You will analyze product performance metrics to drive continuous improvement.
* You will support the entire product development lifecycle from concept to launch.
* You will create clear, comprehensive product documentation for cross-functional communication.
* You will participate in strategic product review sessions with leadership.


**About The Team**
 Intern Community:
   

  

 As an Amazon Intern, you'll be part of a , supportive community that empowers your growth and development. You'll collaborate with interns from around the world, networking and participating in social events to broaden your perspectives. You can also join specialized groups focused on areas like sustainability to explore your diverse interests.
   

  

 Support:
   

  

 The internship program provides a robust support system, including weekly intern office hours, dedicated IT and HR support, and a program team committed to your success. This ensures you have the guidance and assistance needed to thrive.
   

  

 Learning Sessions:
   

  

 Exclusive learning sessions will further enhance your skills, granting you access to Amazon's learning platforms and the expertise of industry leaders. These structured development opportunities will prepare you for the next step in your career.
   

  

 Opportunities:
   

  

 Upon successful completion of the internship, you may be considered for a graduate role or a second internship, allowing you to continue your journey with Amazon. Additionally, you'll enjoy a competitive monthly salary, relocation support, and access to a range of employee benefits.
   

  

 Internship Start Dates across the year:
   

  

 We are hiring interns to start on standardised dates from January through July.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Currently in your penultimate year and working towards a university bachelor's or master's degree in Business, Economics, Marketing, Engineering or related field.
* Available for a full-time internship (40 hours/week) lasting from 3 to 6 months with a start date between January and July.
* Proficient in spoken and written English (Common European Framework of Reference C1 or equivalent).
* Analytical skills with advanced level in Microsoft Excel (e.g., formulas, pivot tables, macros).
* Basic understanding of product management concepts and customer-centric thinking.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Strong problem-solving skills with innovative solution development.
* Experience with product management tools and methodologies (e.g., Agile, user story mapping, wireframing tools).
* Excellent communication skills.
* Leadership experience through academic projects or extracurricular activities.
* Understanding of UX/UI design principles.
* Technology and market trends curiosity.


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - Amazon Eu Sarl, Sverige Filial - J85
   

  

 Job ID: A3143937

title: UX-designer till Axfood IT, Stockholm
description:
Välkommen till Axfood IT, en av matbranschens största IT-avdelningar med ungefär 400 medarbetare. Det är vi som ser till att Axfood och alla våra kedjor, kan ligga i framkant vad gäller digital utveckling. Vi jobbar med att utveckla och förbättra allt ifrån e-handel till logistiklösningar och AI.
   

  

 Hos Axfood IT blir du del av ett sammanhang som utmanar och levererar lösningar som gör skillnad, både för våra kollegor och våra kunder. Här finns det alltid möjlighet att lära sig om ny teknik och växa, både som individ och tillsammans med kollegorna.
   

  

**Ditt nya team**
 UX-teamet här på Axfood IT brinner för att skapa lösningar som gör vardagen enklare, både för våra kunder och våra medarbetare. Genom att kombinera insikter från användarstudier med kreativ design och modern teknik, säkerställer vi att varje digital touchpoint är intuitiv, tillgänglig och engagerande, oavsett om det handlar om interna eller externa lösningar.
   

  

 Vi arbetar nära produktägare, utvecklare och verksamheten för att omsätta behoven till smarta, användarvänliga tjänster. Vårt mål? Att leverera upplevelser som inte bara fungerar, utan som gör skillnad.
   

  

**Ett ax-plock – Kollegornas tankar om rollen**
 ”Här finns möjlighet att vara med och forma ett team inom ett relativt nytt kompetensområde i en stor organisation.”
   

  

 ”Att jobba som UX:are på Axfood är väldigt varierat, vi jobbar med allt från stora behovsanalyser till att flytta pixlar i Figma, och allt däremellan.”
   

  

 ”Det vi gör påverkar många, så här kan man verkligen göra stor skillnad”
   

  

**Om rollen**
 I rollen blir du en viktig del av vårt UX-team och arbetar nära utvecklare, produktägare och interna stakeholders i hela organisationen. Fokus ligger på att driva UX-arbetet från behovsanalys till färdig lösning.
   

  

**Vad du får göra i rollen:**
* Genomföra behovsanalyser via intervjuer, enkäter och workshops.
* Ta fram idéer, koncept och skapa prototyper i Figma och iterera tillsammans med utvecklingsteam.
* Jobba med kontinuerlig förbättring av både interna system (t.ex system och appar för butikspersonal) och externa lösningar (t.ex e-handel, kundprogram) och se till att de håller hög användarvänlighet.
* Bidra till att etablera ett enhetligt designspråk för interna och externa plattformar, med hjälp av designsystem.
* Driva frågor kring tillgänglighet (WCAG) och UI-standarder.


**UX-lead har ordet**
 ”Äntligen får vi möjlighet att rekrytera ytterligare en UX-designer till vårt design-team. Detta är en jätteviktig roll för att vi ska kunna jobba mer användarcentrerat, lösa rätt problem och skapa värde för våra användare och kunder. Och vi har jättespännande projekt som väntar under nästa år.” - Pontus Gager, UX Design Lead
   

  

**Stämmer detta in på dig?**
 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du jobbat några år i en liknande organisation och vara van att jobba självständigt mot utvecklare och arkitekter i tvärfunktionella team. Du bör vara ödmjuk, öppen, driven och ha ett ifrågasättande mindset, samt gilla att utmana och förändra för att kunna möta rätt behov hos slutanvändaren, men också ha en förståelse för att förändringar ibland kan vara svåra att genomföra och ta lite tid.
   

  

 Vi tror också att du är en fena på att skapa tillgängliga prototyper i Figma och har du erfarenhet av att bygga stora och komplexa designsystem det är det också ett stor fördel. Gillar du dessutom att jobba kontinuerligt och långsiktigt med olika typer av digitala produkter och tjänster, så är det här verkligen något för dig.
   

  

**Du har även:**
* Minst fem års erfarenhet som UX-designer, gärna i en större organisation.
* Vana att presentera och argumentera för UX och design
* Erfarenhet och kunskap om designprocesser och designmetodik och hur det bidrar till en bättre användarupplevelse
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att jobba med tillgänglighetsfrågor


**Ansökningsprocessen**
 Vi vill att det ska vara enkelt att söka jobb hos oss. Om du inte har ett CV redo räcker det med att du länkar en väl ifylld LinkedIn-profil. I din ansökan får du svara på de frågor vi behöver svar på i den här delen av processen, och personligt brev är därför inte obligatoriskt. Vi kommer också be dig att skicka en portfolio till oss.
   

  

 Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan därför tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag den 18/1 2026. Vår rekryteringsprocess innehåller tester, intervjuer, bakgrundskontroll och ID-kontroll. Observera att vi inte under denna rekryteringsprocess kommer be dig logga in med ditt Bank-id eller scanna någon QR-kod, men vi kommer be dig styrka din identitet i processens slutskede.
   

  

 Vid frågor om rekrytering på Axfood, kontakta Medarbetarsupporten på jobb@axfood.se. Läs mer: Så går det till när du söker jobb inom Axfood. Om du har frågor om tjänsten, kontakta elisabeth.wehlin@axfood.se. Av GDPR-skäl behandlar vi inga ansökningar eller annan personlig information via mail.
   

  

 Lyssna på en pod om att jobba på Axfood IT, på Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/episode/37BDOFjcKLkdyleKXLEKXZ?si=UVhPBFC4T96dy-tHa9uuDw

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
**The role**
 We’re hiring a Senior Product Designer to shape the core experience of the most intuitive legal platform in the world. You’ll work end-to-end—exploring ideas, crafting clear interfaces, and refining details in close collaboration with engineers. The role is execution-first: your strength lies in turning complex workflows into simple, powerful interfaces, especially as we design new patterns for working with AI.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Design user flows, interactions, and interfaces for AI-powered tools
* Turn ambiguous problems into concrete, high-quality product experiences
* Work hands-on with engineers to bring your designs to life
* Use Figma to design, document, and iterate with speed
* Contribute to—and help scale—our design system
* Push for clarity, consistency, and quality in every corner of the product


**Who You Are**
* Strong experience designing digital products end-to-end
* A portfolio that shows clear thinking, elegant UI, and shipped product work
* Sharp visual skills and attention to detail
* Curiosity about how AI changes user behavior and interfaces
* Pragmatism and a bias toward shipping over theorizing


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Staff Product Designer
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
**The role**
 At Legora, we’re building the category-defining AI product for legal work. As a Staff Product Designer, you’ll operate at the highest level of our design org. You’ll shape how the entire product fits together, drive strategy for our most complex problem spaces, and set the standard for design quality across the company.
   

  

 You’ll partner directly with leadership in design, product, and engineering to define where we’re going, while still rolling up your sleeves to deliver best-in-class interaction and visual design. This is a role for a designer who thrives on solving hard problems and multiplying the impact of the whole team.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Lead design across multiple product areas, ensuring coherence and clarity at the system level.
* Shape product strategy: frame the hardest problems, influence roadmaps, and push for bold but practical solutions.
* Set and evolve the quality bar for design craft, accessibility, and usability across Legora’s product.
* Partner with engineering and product leadership to make tradeoffs that preserve experience while shipping fast.
* Explore entirely new product directions, from zero-to-one ideas to scaled launches.


**Who You Are**
* Extensive product design experience with a track record of shipping complex, high-impact products.
* Exceptional craft in interaction and visual design, combined with the ability to connect details to strategy.
* Comfortable working in complex domains and navigating ambiguous problem spaces.
* Skilled at moving seamlessly between hands-on design and high-level product thinking.
* Strong communication skills: you inspire confidence across product, engineering, and leadership.


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Final Art - Parental Leave Cover
description:
*At Happy Socks we have made it our mission to spread happiness everywhere, and you only have to spend a few minutes with us to realize how seriously we take it! Our strong and fast growth is built on pro-active, smart, creative, hands-on and hardworking people who embrace Happy Socks’ culture & spirit.*
 We are now looking for person excelling in
 **Final Art** 
 to join our
 **in-house Team.** 
 You’ll support
 **the Creative team** 
 with developing graphic material and delivering artworks to print to help fulfill our creative needs and deliverables. The work involves all media platforms, including marketing materials, packaging, press and print advertising and retail material. You will be part of a happy and extremely driven multicultural company, and based at our
 **HQ in Stockholm.**
**Tasks & Responsibilities**
* Develop artworks for graphic material and assets, including but not limited to: catalogues, gift boxes and labels, retail assets, posters, ads, campaign material, brochures, display material, sales material
* Handle communication with our printing partners considering quality, delivery and printing techniques
* Support with image processing
* Support the Graphic Designers in the development of creative material and assets within the creative team to help fulfill the company’s creative needs and deliverables
* Create both internal and external material for sales and marketing purposes based on creative direction and brand guidelines
* Create presentations for internal and external use
* Amend, revise and redevelop campaigns and artworks in response to feedback from the Team lead or stakeholders


**Requirements & Skills**
* Degree in Graphic Design or equivalent
* 2+ years experience from working at an agency or an in-house marketing department
* Excellent knowledge of Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, Powerpoint, Figma and Keynote
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken


 There will be tight deadlines and you'll work on several campaigns at the same time which require that you are structured and work well under pressure. You are also solution-oriented, detail-oriented and make sure your work has a high quality. You have a happy-get-it-done attitude and are a true team player!
   

  

 But most importantly, you have the personality to fit a somewhat crazy, fun work environment where we believe in color and playfulness, a place where you can expect the unexpected and you are a source of creative weirdness.
   

  

*We would love to hear from you as soon as possible since we’re going through applications continually!*
**This is a temporary position expected to cover a maternity leave for approx 1 year with a start date beginning of March 2026.**
 Happy Socks aims to spread happiness by turning an everyday essential into a colorful design piece. The business is built on foundations of rigid quality standards, craftsmanship and creativity that are transferred into the products by a talented team of creatives. The products feature endless variations of models and designs, using a broad spectrum of color combinations and original patterns.

title: Kravanalytiker
description:
*Har du erfarenhet som verksamhetsanalytiker, kravanalytiker, kravledare, tjänstedesigner eller motsvarande inom systemutveckling?* 
*KTH söker två kravanalytiker som ska verka för att systemstöden ska möta verksamhetens behov och krav. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!*
 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som kravanalytiker ingår du i ett team som förvaltar och utvecklar systemstöd till KTH:s olika verksamheter. Där är ditt ansvar att planera, leda och utföra aktiviteter som leder till att teamet och leverantörer förstår behoven bakom och kraven på systemstöden. Du bedriver kravanalys och kravformulering tillsammans med representanter från verksamheterna. Baserat på det har du en viktig roll i att formulera teamets målsättningar, men också i att definiera lösningar. Nyttoanalys, värdering och prioritering i förhållande till teamets förutsättningar är naturligt integrerat i ditt arbetssätt.
   

  

**I Rollen Kommer Du Även Att**
* Dokumentera, bevara och sprida relevant information om målverksamheten samt identifierade behov och krav.
* Samverka med intressenter om hur information om verksamheten, dess behov och krav ska tolkas.
* Följa upp mål- och kravuppfyllelse med beställare och andra nära intressenter.


**Om avdelningen/enheten**
 Verksamhetsstödets uppgift är att stödja universitetets utbildning och forskning. KTH:s verksamhetsstöd är inne i en spännande fas där vi tillsammans arbetar med utveckling av våra arbetsformer. Som medarbetare inom verksamhetsstödet bidrar du till KTH:s uppdrag att forska, utbilda och skapa samhällsnytta och får samtidigt möjlighet till egen professionell utveckling
   

  

 Med cirka 150 medarbetare organiserade över fyra specialiserade enheter erbjuder vår IT-avdelning en stödjande och berikande miljö där du kan trivas både professionellt och personligt. Du kommer att tillhöra systemutvecklingsenheten som i dag har omkring 60 medarbetare i roller som systemutvecklare, teamledare, UX-designers, tjänstedesigners och IT-specialister.
   

  

**Teamet**
 Du kommer att matchas med ett av de aktuella team som passar din kompetens och dina utvecklingsmål. Team som arbetar med systemstöd för digital arbetsmiljö/samarbetsverktyg, ekonomi eller HR har behov av din kompetens just nu.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

**Krav**
* Minst 3 års sammanlagd aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet i rollen som verksamhetsanalytiker, kravanalytiker, tjänstedesigner eller motsvarande inom systemutveckling.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av att organisera och leda workshops för behov- och kravinsamling.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av att formulera och kommunicera behov och krav enligt vedertagna modeller, som exempelvis user stories.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av att värdera och prioritera behov, krav och åtgärder enligt vedertagna modeller, som exempelvis effektkartläggning, nyttoanalys eller motsvarande.
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka sig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska krävs i det dagliga arbetet (kommer att verifieras under eventuell intervju).
* Relevant akademisk utbildning.


 Vi söker dig som är relationsskapande och kan samarbeta effektivt med olika intressenter. Du är självgående och tar ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter, samtidigt som du har helhetssyn och förstår hur olika delar av verksamheten hänger ihop. Rollen kräver att du är kvalitetsmedveten och levererar noggrant arbete, samt att du är strukturerad och kan hantera flera parallella uppgifter på ett effektivt sätt.
   

  

**Meriterande**
* Minst kandidatexamen från högskola eller universitet.
* Minst 3 års sammanlagd aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet som kravledare.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet i rollen som verksamhetsanalytiker, kravanalytiker, kravledare eller motsvarande för utveckling eller förvaltning av digitala stöd till ekonomiprocesser eller HR-processer.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet i en operativ roll inom systemutveckling.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av upphandling inom offentlig sektor.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av utveckling eller förvaltning av digitala stöd inom myndighet.


 Vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Bli en del av KTH
   

  

 KTH formar framtiden genom utbildning, forskning och innovation. Som ett ledande internationellt tekniskt universitet spelar vi en aktiv roll i att driva och medverka i omställningen till ett hållbart samhälle. Här erbjuds du möjligheten att växa och utvecklas på en kreativ och dynamisk arbetsplats med goda arbetsvillkor och förmåner. Jämställdhet, mångfald och lika villkor är en kvalitetsfråga och en självklar del av KTH:s värdegrund som universitet och statlig myndighet.
   

  

 Läs mer om våra förmåner och hur det är att arbeta och utvecklas på KTH.
   

  

 Fackliga representanter
   

  

 Kontaktuppgifter till fackliga representanter.
   

  

 Ansökan
   

  

 Du ansöker via KTH:s rekryteringssystem. Du som sökande har huvudansvaret för att din ansökan är komplett när den skickas in och att de kvalifikationer vi efterfrågar i annonsen framgår i ditt CV. Ansökan ska vara KTH tillhanda senast sista ansökningsdagen vid midnatt, CET/CEST (CentralEuropean Time/Central European Summer Time).
   

  

 Om anställningen
   

  

 Anställningen gäller tillsvidare enligt avtal.
   

  

 Anställningen inleds med sex månaders provanställning.
   

  

 Övrigt
   

  

 För information om behandling av personuppgifter i samband med rekrytering.
   

  

 Det kan förekomma att en anställning hos KTH är placerad i säkerhetsklass. Om så är fallet för just denna anställning görs en säkerhetsprövning av sökande i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) efter samtycke. I dessa fall är en förutsättning för anställning att sökande blir godkänd efter säkerhetsprövning.
   

  

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av platsannonser.

title: Data Engineer
description:
*KTH har etablerat Microsoft Fabric som kärnan i sin dataplattform och söker nu två Data Engineers som vill driva utvecklingen vidare.* 
*Är du redo att ta en nyckelroll i KTH:s resa mot smartare och mer datadrivna arbetssätt?*
 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som Data Engineer hos KTH arbetar du med att utveckla, kvalitetssäkra och förvalta KTH:s centrala analys- och dataplattform i Microsoft Fabric. Du är med och bygger robusta, skalbara datalösningar som möjliggör datadrivet beslutsfattande inom exempelvis ekonomi, HR och utbildning. I rollen ingår att skapa strukturerade dataprodukter, modellera semantiska modeller och stötta verksamheten i att ta steget mot ett mer datadrivet arbetssätt.
   

  

**I Rollen Kommer Du Att**
* Bygga, vidareutveckla och förvalta KTH:s analys- och dataplattform i Microsoft Fabric.
* Utforma och optimera Lakehouse-strukturen enligt medallion-modellen (brons, silver, guld).
* Säkerställa datakvalitet genom rensning, validering, standardisering och deduplicering i varje lager.
* Modellera analysfärdiga dataprodukter i star-schema-design, inkl. mått, KPI:er och semantiska modeller.
* Skapa och optimera Power BI-modeller och rapporter i linje med KTH:s grafiska riktlinjer.
* Utveckla och förbättra transformationer med PySpark-notebooks.
* Bygga skalbara pipelines för data från interna system och externa datakällor.
* Bidra till metadatahantering och långsiktig arkitekturutveckling för en skalbar och framtidssäkrad plattform.
* Arbeta enligt DevOps-metodik med versionshantering av notebooks, SQL-skript och dataprodukter.
* Implementera CI/CD-flöden för Fabric-artefakter via Azure DevOps Pipelines.


**Om avdelningen/enheten**
 Verksamhetsstödets uppgift är att stödja universitetets utbildning och forskning. KTH:s verksamhetsstöd är inne i en spännande fas där vi tillsammans arbetar med utveckling av våra arbetsformer. Som medarbetare inom verksamhetsstödet bidrar du till KTH:s uppdrag att forska, utbilda och skapa samhällsnytta och får samtidigt möjlighet till egen professionell utveckling
   

  

 Med cirka 150 medarbetare organiserade över fyra specialiserade enheter erbjuder vår IT-avdelning en stödjande och berikande miljö där du kan trivas både professionellt och personligt. Du kommer att tillhöra systemutvecklingsenheten som i dag har omkring 60 medarbetare i roller som systemutvecklare, teamledare, UX-designers, tjänstedesigners och IT-specialister.
   

  

**Teamet**
 Du ingår i ett tvärfunktionellt team och samarbetar närmast med projektledning, arkitekter, analytiker och verksamheten i det dagliga planerings- och leveransarbetet.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

**Krav**
* Relevant akademisk utbildning eller på annat sätt förvärvade motsvarande kunskaper som arbetsgivaren bedömer som likvärdiga.
* Aktuell erfarenhet av att designa, implementera och underhålla datalager och metadatadrivna ETL-processer.
* Erfarenhet av och djup förståelse för Microsoft Fabric-komponenter, särskilt Data Pipeline, Notebook, semantiska modeller och lakehouse.
* Minst 5 års aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av Datamodellering.
* Aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av utveckling i PySpark/Python samt SQL.
* Förmåga att utföra utforskande dataanalys och omsätta dessa till interaktiva dashboards och rapporter med hjälp av t.ex. Power BI.
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift krävs i det dagliga arbetet.


 Vi söker dig som är självgående och tar ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter. Du har god samarbetsförmåga och bidrar till ett positivt arbetsklimat. Du arbetar strukturerat och är kvalitetsmedveten, med fokus på hållbara och tillförlitliga lösningar.
   

  

**Meriterande**
* Microsoft Certified: Fabric Data Engineer Associate (DP-700) och/eller Microsoft Certified: Fabric Analytics Engineer Associate (DP-600).
* Erfarenhet av versionshantering (Git) samt CI/CD specifikt mot Microsoft Fabric och Azure DevOps.
* Kunskap om datasäkerhet och regelefterlevnad.
* Erfarenhet av att designa, konsumera och hantera datacentriska API:er så som t.ex. REST och GraphQL.
* Förmåga att översätta affärskrav till tekniska lösningar och från olika verksamhetsområden


 Vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Bli en del av KTH
   

  

 KTH formar framtiden genom utbildning, forskning och innovation. Som ett ledande internationellt tekniskt universitet spelar vi en aktiv roll i att driva och medverka i omställningen till ett hållbart samhälle. Här erbjuds du möjligheten att växa och utvecklas på en kreativ och dynamisk arbetsplats med goda arbetsvillkor och förmåner. Jämställdhet, mångfald och lika villkor är en kvalitetsfråga och en självklar del av KTH:s värdegrund som universitet och statlig myndighet.
   

  

 Läs mer om våra förmåner och hur det är att arbeta och utvecklas på KTH.
   

  

 Fackliga representanter
   

  

 Kontaktuppgifter till fackliga representanter.
   

  

 Ansökan
   

  

 Du ansöker via KTH:s rekryteringssystem. Du som sökande har huvudansvaret för att din ansökan är komplett när den skickas in och att de kvalifikationer vi efterfrågar i annonsen framgår i ditt CV. Ansökan ska vara KTH tillhanda senast sista ansökningsdagen vid midnatt, CET/CEST (CentralEuropean Time/Central European Summer Time).
   

  

 Om anställningen
   

  

 Anställningen gäller tillsvidare enligt avtal.
   

  

 Anställningen inleds med sex månaders provanställning.
   

  

 Övrigt
   

  

 För information om behandling av personuppgifter i samband med rekrytering.
   

  

 Det kan förekomma att en anställning hos KTH är placerad i säkerhetsklass. Om så är fallet för just denna anställning görs en säkerhetsprövning av sökande i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) efter samtycke. I dessa fall är en förutsättning för anställning att sökande blir godkänd efter säkerhetsprövning.
   

  

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av platsannonser.

title: Senior Product Designer - Activities(Bangkok - Based, Relocation Provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 At Agoda, we bridge the world through travel. Our story began in 2005, when two lifelong friends and entrepreneurs, driven by their passion for travel, launched Agoda to make it easier for everyone to explore the world.
   

  

 Today, we are part of Booking Holdings [NASDAQ: BKNG], with a diverse team of over 7,000 people from 90 countries, working together in offices around the globe. Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide.
   

  

 No two days are the same at Agoda. Data and technology are at the heart of our culture, fueling our curiosity and innovation. If you’re ready to begin your best journey and help build travel for the world, join us.
   

  

**Get to Know Our Design Team:**
 The Design team is a diverse group of product designers that help to build Agoda’s products from our home office in Bangkok. Being a product-driven company, we partner with product managers and engineers to understand user problems and design workflows, interactions, and visual interfaces.
   

  

 There is always an opportunity for growth here. Focus on your craft to improve or expand your skill set, or step into a managerial role and flex your talents as a designer and driver of team projects. This is a great time to join a team that’s small enough to be scrappy and hands on, yet big enough to influence change and product strategy.
   

  

 At Agoda, we offer a range of travel products – including accommodations, flights, and activities – and are building the next generation of travel experiences to help customers plan and book their entire trip. We’re looking for a
 **Senior Product Designer** 
 to help transform the way users search for, and book activities.
   

  

 As a
 **Senior Product Designer** 
 , you’ll own end-to-end user journeys, leading the design of intuitive, engaging experiences that make it seamless for users to discover, search for, and book activities on Agoda. In this role, you’ll drive design strategy, collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, and ensure our product sets the benchmark for usability and innovation in the online travel industry.
   

  

 In your day-to-day work, you’ll turn strategy into actionable design solutions by setting design direction, solving complex challenges, and delivering experiences that are intuitive, scalable, and grounded in user insights. You’ll champion user needs throughout the product lifecycle, using research and data to continuously refine our activities offerings.
   

  

**Experience Requirements & Role Expectations:**
* 6+ years of full-time experience as a product designer for digital or web-based products; in-house experience highly preferred.
* Independently create visually stunning, intuitive, and scalable user interfaces, and interactions. You sweat the details and care deeply about craft.
* Proficient in both quantitative and qualitative research, with hands-on experience running user interviews, synthesizing findings, and generating actionable insights to inform design decisions.
* Take full ownership of the design process for a dedicated scrum, from discovery to delivery. You’ll set the design vision, define the user experience, and ensure high-quality execution.
* Partner with product managers to shape product vision and roadmap. You’ll use quantitative data, qualitative research insights, and business context to inform your design decisions, always balancing user needs with business goals.
* Manage multiple stakeholders within an agile development process
* Strong communicator who can articulate design rationale, influence stakeholders, and build trust across disciplines.
* A strong portfolio of work that demonstrates your design thinking, process, and solutions showcasing beautiful, user-centered web and mobile product design.


**Day to day, it looks like:**
* Develop design solutions that address both business objectives and customer needs
* Manage and communicate with stakeholders to ensure alignment and on-time delivery of features
* Test prototypes and hypotheses with users to gather actionable feedback
* Present your work to peers and leadership, both asynchronously and in person
* Participate in weekly design critiques, workshops, all-hands, and team meetings
* Document your design process and clearly articulate your decisions
* Champion cohesion and consistency in UX design across our expanding suite of products and features
* Bring a strategic vision to implementing experiences that balance customer needs with business, content, and technology


**Senior Product Designer at Agoda means you have a track record of:**
* Managing ambiguity—working alongside your design partners in driving discovery and ideation workshops and align the group around a vision and approach
* Crafting sophisticated flows and customer journeys
* Thinking and crafting at a system level, not just interface elements or pages
* Regularly making use of your soft skills: listening, negotiating, decision-making
* Effectively articulating your ideas and design solutions
* Demonstrating initiative and proactiveness
* Expressing feedback with kindness and candor
* Balancing multiple priorities and successfully delivering in a fast-paced, dynamic environment


 #seattle #sanfrancisco #beijing #newyork #london #bangkok #singapore #chicago #hongkong #singapore #berlin #shanghai #losangeles #boston #austin #toronto #luxembourg #munich #oslo #copenhagen #stockholm #helsinki #brussels #hamburg #stuttgart #taipei #hamburg #stuttgart #dublin #telaviv #sydney #melbourne #perth #vancouver #montreal #prague #paris #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #tokyo #osaka #amsterdam #moscow #saintpetersburg #frankfurt #shenzhen #istanbul #dubai #kiev #seoul
   

  

**Discover More About Working At Agoda**
* Agoda Careers https://careersatagoda.com
* Facebook https://www.facebook.com/agodacareers/
* LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/agoda
* YouTube https://www.youtube.com/agodalife


**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy.
   

  

**Disclaimer**
 We do not accept any terms or conditions, nor do we recognize any agency’s representation of a candidate, from unsolicited third-party or agency submissions. If we receive unsolicited or speculative CVs, we reserve the right to contact and hire the candidate directly without any obligation to pay a recruitment fee.

title: Senior Product Designer - AI Assistant & Conversational UX (Bangkok - Based, Relocation Provided)
description:
****About Agoda****
 At Agoda, we bridge the world through travel. Our story began in 2005, when two lifelong friends and entrepreneurs, driven by their passion for travel, launched Agoda to make it easier for everyone to explore the world.
   

  

 Today, we are part of Booking Holdings [NASDAQ: BKNG], with a diverse team of over 7,000 people from 90 countries, working together in offices around the globe. Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide.
   

  

 No two days are the same at Agoda. Data and technology are at the heart of our culture, fueling our curiosity and innovation. If you’re ready to begin your best journey and help build travel for the world, join us.
   

  

****About Agoda****
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Get to Know Our Design Team:**
 The Design team is a diverse group of product designers and researchers that help to build Agoda’s products from our home office in Bangkok. Being a product-driven company, we constantly partner with product managers and engineers to understand user problems and design workflows, interactions, and visual interfaces.
   

  

 There is always an opportunity for growth here. Focus on your craft to improve or expand your skill set, or step into a managerial role and flex your talents as a designer and driver of team projects. This is a great time to join a team that’s small enough to be scrappy and hands on, yet big enough to influence change and product strategy.
   

  

 We’re building the next generation of AI-powered travel experiences, and conversational UX is central to that vision. Join our design team to help shape how users engage with intelligent travel assistants, real-time chat, and natural language interfaces across platforms.
   

  

**AI-Powered Travel Experiences Team:**
 As a
 **Senior Product Designer, AI & Conversational UX** 
 , you’ll lead the design of AI-driven chat that powers Agoda’s AI Assistant, trip planning & discovery, customer support flows, and proactive recommendations. You’ll partner closely with engineers, data scientists, and product managers to design interactions that feel human, helpful, and seamless.
   

  

 This is a hands-on role where you’ll set UX strategy, drive complex design initiatives, and ensure our conversational experiences are intuitive, scalable, and grounded in user needs.
   

  

****What You’ll Do****
* Design end-to-end conversational flows across chatbots, messaging UIs, voice interfaces, and contextual surfaces on web and mobile
* Translate AI and machine learning capabilities into user-centered features with clear, guided interactions
* Build interaction models, flows, and prototypes that communicate intent and optimize for speed, clarity, and trust
* Collaborate with AI/ML, product, and engineering to test, iterate, and scale new features
* Advocate for accessibility, usability, and design quality across all touchpoints
* Partner with content team, researchers, and other designers to define content strategies for natural, human-centric dialogues
* Collaborate closely with the Design Systems team to ensure assistant UI components are scalable and deliver a seamless experience across chat and all app surfaces.
* Help define design principles and best practices for conversational UX at Agoda
* Align on design direction through data-driven decisions, leveraging research and best practices, and proactively collaborating with PMs and stakeholders to validate concepts via user testing, experiments, or data analysis


****What You’ll Bring****
* 6+ years of experience in product or interaction design, ideally with a strong focus on conversational interfaces, chatbots, or AI-driven tools
* Bring a data-driven mindset to the role, leveraging research, data, and industry best practices to inform design decisions, and extensive experience validating ideas through user testing, experiments, and analysis in partnership with cross-functional teams.
* A portfolio showcasing end-to-end design work for messaging, chat, or AI-powered user flows
* Strong systems thinking and interaction design skills — you can connect user needs with technical possibilities and design scalable solutions
* Familiarity with the mechanics and constraints of LLMs, generative AI, or natural language processing
* Experience with Figma, prototyping tools, and user research methodologies
* A user-first mindset and passion for simplifying complexity through clear design
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills in cross-functional settings


**Bonus Points**
* Background in voice UX, multimodal interfaces, or customer support tools
* Experience with localization and designing for multilingual audiences
* Familiarity with personalization engines or recommendation system
* Prior experience in travel, e-commerce, or large-scale B2C platforms


 #seattle #sanfrancisco #beijing #newyork #london #bangkok #singapore #chicago #hongkong #singapore #berlin #shanghai #losangeles #boston #austin #toronto #luxembourg #munich #oslo #copenhagen #stockholm #helsinki #brussels #hamburg #stuttgart #taipei #hamburg #stuttgart #dublin #telaviv #sydney #melbourne #perth #vancouver #montreal #prague #paris #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #tokyo #osaka #amsterdam #moscow #saintpetersburg #frankfurt #shenzhen #istanbul #dubai #kiev #seoul

Vill du vara med att bidra med teknisk helhetssyn genom hela livscykeln och vara med och påverka tekniska vägval, kvalitet och långsiktig hållbarhet i KTH:s systemlandskap? Då är du välkommen med din ansökan till oss.*
