 Vi söker dig som kombinerar strategisk höjd med operativ handlingskraft. Du är van att leda i förändring och trivs i rollen som både systemägare, beställare och moderniseringsdrivande kraft. Du är en trygg ledare med förmåga att motivera, kommunicera och bygga förtroende – både internt och externt. Rollen kräver energi, framåtlutning och en tydlig vilja att få saker att hända.
 



  





 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi du behöver:
 


* Erfarenhet av att leda IT-team med personalansvar
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av större digitaliseringsprojekt och systembyten
* Erfaren beställare av externa IT-leverantörer
* God kompetens inom Microsoft-miljö (Microsoft 365, Azure, Windows Server)
* Trygg i både strategiskt och operativt arbete
* Vara flytande i svenska språket



  





 Det är meriterande om du har:
 


* Erfarenhet från handels- eller logistikverksamhet
* Arbetat med IT-säkerhet och ramverk som ISO 27001
* Erfarenhet av arbete i ledningsgrupp



  





 Hos Förlagssystem får du mer än ett jobb – du blir en del av ett värderingsdrivet företag där kunskap, glädje, engagemang, ansvar och känslan av att göra det tillsammans genomsyrar allt vi gör.
 



  





*Förlagssystem samarbetar med Safemind för denna rekrytering.*

title: Information Systems Compliance Lead
description:
**Build something monumental for Healthcare!**
 At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.
   

  

 We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!
   

  

**About The Role**
 You’re the kind of person who genuinely enjoys order - the person who feels a deep sense of satisfaction when systems align, documentation is complete, and everything is exactly where it should be. At Tandem, that passion becomes a superpower.
   

  

 As our Information Systems Compliance Lead, you’ll sit at the intersection of security, engineering, and governance. You’ll own and drive the frameworks, certifications, and processes that prove our systems are not only well-designed, but trustworthy, safe, and compliant with some of the strictest data protection requirements in the world.
   

  

 You’re technical enough to understand how our product works under the hood, curious enough to ask the right questions, and structured enough to turn ambiguity into robust, auditable systems. You get energy from seeing things
 *work* 
 - reliably, predictably, and repeatably and you take pride in enabling an organisation to operate at a high level of discipline without slowing it down.
   

  

 This is a high-impact role where you’ll help build and evolve Tandem’s information governance foundation as we scale across markets and regulatory environments.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Own and lead Tandem’s information governance and ISMS (Information Security Management System).
* Drive certification efforts end-to-end for frameworks such as ISO 27001 and GDPR alignment.
* Prepare for and lead internal and external audits, ensuring our systems, documentation, and processes are always audit-ready.
* Work closely with engineering to ensure our systems comply with security and data protection standards and that we can prove it.
* Partner with teams across the organisation - Engineering, HR/Recruiting, Legal, Product, GTM to embed governance practices into everyday work.
* Track, document, and continuously improve the processes that keep our information systems consistent, reliable, and compliant.
* Collaborate with the Head of Security and IT to maintain a unified approach to security, compliance, and operational excellence.
* Identify gaps, risks, and opportunities for improvement and drive initiatives to close them with clarity and structure.


**What You Bring**
* Experience leading ISMS implementation and maintaining certification readiness across multiple standards.
* Proven hands-on involvement in ISO 27001 audits, must have completed at least one full audit cycle.
* A structured, detail-obsessed mindset, you thrive when processes, documentation, and systems are clean and functioning end-to-end.
* Strong technical curiosity; you can understand how software works, ask good questions, and collaborate deeply with technical teams.
* Ability to influence and drive change across teams in a fast-moving, high-growth environment.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to translate compliance requirements into clear, actionable guidance.


**Bonus Points**
* Background in engineering, machine engineering, computer science, or a related technical discipline.
* Experienced in analyzing and applying overlapping security requirements from multiple regulations for example with one or several of: ISO 13485, SOC 2, Cyber Essentials, ENS, German C5, Finnish A1, or GDPR operationalisation.
* Experience designing or maturing an ISMS from the ground up.
* Understanding of how to balance compliance with usability and speed.
* Familiarity with healthtech, medical device regulation, or highly regulated industries.
* Experience working with AI systems or data-intensive environments.


**Culture at Tandem**
 At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.
   

  

 Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.
   

  

 Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.
   

  

 We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.
   

  

*Tandem handles sensitive patient data and will conduct a background check before hiring any candidate.*

title: UX Researcher
description:
**TL;DR –** 
 We’re looking for a curious, fast-moving UX Researcher to help shape the future of Lovable. You’ll uncover how users think, feel, and act, turning insights into product direction. You’ll design studies, test concepts, and experiment with new AI-assisted ways of learning from users, helping us move fast without compromising on craft.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products — fast. We are at the forefront of a fundamental shift in how software is created: from code-first to intelligence-first.
   

  

 Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate workflows, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We operate with high ownership, high velocity, and low-ego collaboration. We care deeply, move fast, and are here to build something that outlives us.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
 We’re looking for a researcher who balances
 **curiosity and rigor** 
 — someone who loves asking
 *why* 
 , tests
 *how* 
 , and measures
 *what’s working* 
 . You’re as comfortable in a user interview as you are interpreting event data or survey results, and you know how to connect human stories with product metrics.
   

  

* 3–6 years of experience in UX research, human-centered design, or a related role.
* Proficiency in qualitative methods (interviews, usability testing, concept testing).
* Experience with survey design, data analysis, and working with behavioral data (e.g., from analytics tools) is a plus
* Strong synthesis skills, distilling findings into insights that influence design and product decisions.
* Excellent communication and storytelling skills to bring research to life for cross-functional teams.
* Comfortable in fast-paced, iterative environments with shifting priorities.
* Experience working closely with designers, PMs, and data scientists.


**What You’ll Do**
 In one sentence:
   

  

**Turn user insights into product direction that shapes how the world builds software.**
* Partner with product, design, growth and data teams to define learning goals for upcoming features and experiments.
* Explore new AI-driven approaches for recruiting, analysis, and synthesis — expanding how we learn from users.
* Conduct user sessions directly with Lovable users, gathering firsthand insights into behaviors, motivations, and unmet needs.
* Collaborate with data scientists to interpret behavioral data and validate qualitative findings.
* Contribute to building research frameworks, templates, and best practices for scalable discovery at Lovable.


**How We Hire**
* Fill out a short form and hop on a quick intro call with our recruiting team
* Meet designers and PMs to discuss your approach to research
* Walk through past work and real examples of your process
* Final conversations with product leadership


**About Your Application**
 Please submit your application in English — it’s our company language.
   

  

 We treat all candidates equally, so please apply through our careers portal.

title: Senior Mechanical Engineer
description:
Är du en erfaren mekanikkonstruktör med stor kompetens inom avancerad CAD och ett intresse för att arbeta i tekniskt utmanande utvecklingsprojekt? Vi söker dig som vill bidra med din expertis inom konstruktion och produktutveckling i en miljö där kvalitet, innovation och samarbete står i fokus.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som har:** 



* En högskole- eller civilingenjörsexamen inom Maskinteknik, Industriell teknik/design, Flygteknik eller likvärdig teknisk utbildning.
* **Minst 8 års erfarenhet av mekanisk konstruktion** 
 , gärna inom komplexa produktutvecklingsmiljöer.
* **Djup kunskap i ett professionellt CAD-verktyg** 
 , såsom
 **Siemens NX, CATIA, SolidWorks eller liknande**
* Goda kommunikativa färdigheter och van att arbeta både självständigt och i tvärfunktionella team.
* **Flytande svenska i tal och skrift (krav).**



  





**Du kommer att arbeta med:** 



* Konstruktion och utveckling av avancerade 3D-modeller och tekniska lösningar i professionella CAD-verktyg.
* Samarbete med tvärfunktionella team för att säkerställa att konstruktioner uppfyller funktions-, tillverknings- och integrationskrav.
* Aktivt deltagande i design- och tekniska granskningar, där du bidrar med förbättringsförslag kopplade till tillverkningsbarhet, prestanda och kvalitet.
* Stöd vid prototyputveckling och verifiering vid behov inom våra kunders projekt.



  





**Vill du växa och utvecklas tillsammans med oss? Tveka inte – vi är bara en ansökan bort!** 




  





  





**Vad erbjuder vi?** 




  





 Varje medarbetare är lika viktig i ALTENs framgång! Vi tror på att växa tillsammans genom att erbjuda möjligheter, utveckling och gemenskap.ALTEN verkar inom flera olika branscher, har en stor variation av uppdrag, coachande chefer och utbildning via ALTEN Academy vilket gör att det alltid kommer vara möjligt att utvecklashos oss. Dina önskemål styr din väg framåt.
 



 Som konsult får du både en teamkänsla i ditt uppdrag och en riktigt härlig gemenskap på ALTEN. Genom våra interna nätverk såsom Women@ALTEN och ALTEN Sports ges du möjlighet att driva frågor och aktiviteter som just du brinner för. På ALTEN tycker vi det är viktigt med balans mellan arbete och fritid, därför erbjuder vi tre extra lediga dagar per år.Hos oss är du ansluten till kollektivavtal ocherbjuds förmåner så som friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension och försäkringar.
 



  





**Om ALTEN** 




 ALTEN är ett av Europas största teknik- och IT-konsultföretag med över 57 000 anställda cirka 30 länder. Våra ingenjörer utför komplexa och mycket tekniska projekt genom helaproduktutvecklingskedjan hos de främsta företagen inom flera olika branscher såsom Fordon, Försvar & Säkerhet, Energi, Industriell utrustning, Public service samt Life sciences. I Sverige är vi cirka 1300 engagerade medarbetare med 9kontor i 9 städer - från Lund i söder till Skellefteå i norr.
 



 ALTEN har för femte året i rad utsetts till en av Sveriges mest attraktiva arbetsgivare avKarriärföretagen, en utmärkelse för arbetsgivare som erbjuder unika karriär- ochutvecklingsmöjligheter.
 



 Välkommen in att läsa mer om oss på alten.se

title: Installatörer
description:
*NjordX är ett innovativt och växande företag som verkar inom det marintekniska området mot statliga myndigheter såsom Kustbevakningen, Försvarsmakten och även den kommersiella sjöfarten. Vi levererar allt från enskilda produkter till kompletta systemlösningar inom kommunikation, navigation och undervattensteknologi till den marina domänen. Vi finns i Stockholm, Göteborg, Karlskrona och Landskrona och är ca 30 personer totalt på företaget.* 




*Just nu är vi inne i en expansiv fas och söker självgående och tekniskt kunniga installationstekniker. Vi söker er som är utåtriktad, kreativ och motiveras av problemlösning. Du förstår vikten av goda kundrelationer och teamwork mellan kollegor för att på snabbast och bästa sätt lösa problem och leverera bra produkter och service.* 




  





 Vi är nu omlokaliserade till Länna, Skogås i helt nyrenoverade lokaler utmed väg 73 söder om Stockholm.
 



 Vi söker nu fler medarbetare till vårt nya kontor.
 



  





**Rollbeskrivning** 




 Som installationstekniker erbjuds du ett varierande arbete som innefattar montage och installation av nya produkter, besiktning, felsökning, service och förebyggande underhåll. Du arbetar direkt mot kunder, främst i Sverige men även internationellt. Det är därför viktigt med ett professionellt kundbemötande och ett stort intresse och kunnande inom teknikområdet. Denna tjänst riktar sig mot kommunikation och traditionell marinelektronik .
 



**Vem är du?** 




 Som person är du ansvarsfull, engagerad och noggrann. Du gillar utmaningar och har ett brinnande teknikintresse. Vi tror att du har minst några års erfarenhet från liknande arbeten alternativt en motsvarande relevant arbetslivserfarenhet. Du har en god kommunikativ förmåga i svenska och engelska. Du har B-körkort. Är svensk medborgare.
 



**Vi erbjuder dig** 




 En arbetsplats med fördomsfria, ambitiösa och entusiastiska kollegor. Ett spännande och utvecklande arbete med marknadsledande produkter inom den marina miljön. Du kommer tillhöra ett team med mycket driv, hög kompetens och öppenhet där vi tillsammans hjälps åt för att lösa våra kunders utmaningar.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




**Vi söker personer som vi tror kommer ifrån liknande områden som vi arbetar i, ex el/ IT/DATA/kommunikations utbildade installatörer. Kvalifikationer som vi letar efter är:** 




  




* Erfarenhet inom installation av system
* Erfarenhet av konfiguration, felsökning och följa ritningar
* förmåga att se lösningar på uppkomna problem
* Relevant teknisk utbildning eller motsvarande
* flytande i tal Engelska och Svenska
* Svensk medborgare

title: Executive Assistant
description:
**Join us to deliver a smoke- free future**
 We’ve chosen to do something incredible. We’re totally transforming our business and building our future with one clear purpose – to deliver a smoke-free future. Swedish Match is an affiliate of PMI and has been a leader in the industry for more than 200 years.
   

  

 In the Nordic region, we are 1,800 employees based in Sweden, Denmark, Finland and Norway working in various functions and teams and together we are collaborating to deliver a smoke-free Nordics.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Are you a proactive, people-centric professional with a passion for supporting senior leadership? We are seeking an Executive Assistant to provide comprehensive support to the President of Oral Product, ensuring smooth day-to-day operations and enabling strategic focus. This is a dynamic role combining executive-level administrative assistance with a strong emphasis on fostering a positive and engaging work environment across our Oral Products organization.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Executive Support:
* Serve as the primary point of contact for the President
* Manage complex calendars, travel arrangements (including expense management and visa applications), and coordinate meetings
* Prepare briefing materials, presentations, and reports for internal and external engagements
* Anticipate needs and provide relevant insights for decision-making
* Event Coordination:
* Organize and coordinate department events (workshops, trainings, dinners)
* Identify venues, negotiate rates, manage logistics, send invitations, book rooms, and arrange catering
* Centralize documentation and agendas
* Liaison & engagement:
* Facilitate communication between the President and senior leadership teams across global offices and functions
* Collaborate with Workplace Experience and People & Culture teams to create a positive work environment in the Stockholm office
* Additional Support:
* Assist other leadership team members with travel, agendas, and administration
* Ensure smooth onboarding for new hires and transfers to Stockholm (support with various local administration aspects)


**Who You Are**
 You have proven experience as an Executive Assistant or in a similar capacity, supporting senior executives within fast-paced, international environments. Your discretion and trustworthiness are essential in handling sensitive information. You demonstrate the ability to work independently, managing tasks with full autonomy while maintaining exceptional organizational and multitasking skills. Your proficiency in MS Office and collaboration tools enable you to operate efficiently in a modern workplace. Strong interpersonal and communication abilities are among your strengths, and you are proactive in problem-solving and anticipating the needs of executives. Fluency in both English and Swedish, both verbal and written, is also required for this position.
   

  

**Education & Experience**
* Vocational education or high school diploma required
* Experience supporting senior executives is essential


 All applicants must have the legal right to work in Sweden.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 Our success depends on the dedicated people who come to work every single day with a sense of purpose and an appetite for progress. Join Swedish Match and you too can:
   

  

* Seize the freedom to define your future and ours. We’ll empower you to take risks, experiment and explore.
* Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture, where everyone’s contribution is respected; collaborate with some of the world’s best people and feel like you belong.
* Enjoy flexibility of hybrid way of working - split your time between working from our office or the comfort of your home, where it works best for you in line with business needs.
* Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills with a global business – our staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress.
* Take pride in delivering our promise to society: to deliver a smoke-free future.


 #SWMA
   

  

**20186**

title: AI Engineer
description:
*Vill du arbeta i teknikens absoluta framkant och skapa AI-lösningar som gör verklig skillnad? Som AI Engineer hos oss på Länsförsäkringar får du vara med och utveckla robusta, skalbara och användarvänliga AI-system som stöttar både våra kunder och medarbetare. Hos oss blir du en del av ett innovativt team där samarbete, kunskapsdelning och nyfikenhet står i centrum.*
*Inom avdelningen Data & AI skapar vi nya möjligheter till proaktiva kundmöten och sömlösa helhetslösningar. Här kan du växa, utvecklas och vara med och bygga framtiden, på riktigt.*
**Om jobbet**
 Som AI-Engineer med fokus på generativ AI blir du en nyckelperson i vårt tvärfunktionella spjutspetsteam inom Data & AI. Vi bygger lösningar från ax till limpa och arbetar med hela livscykeln för våra applikationer. Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta brett över alla lager i applikationen och utveckla din förståelse för hur moderna AI-system fungerar i praktiken.
   

  

 Vi arbetar med flera plattformar - både exponerade mot kund och interna system som används av våra medarbetare. En av våra mest centrala plattformar är vår interna GPT-lösning, som används av över 6000 medarbetare för att effektivisera arbetsflöden, beslutsfattande och kunskapsdelning.
   

  

 Rollen är fokuserad kring tre huvudsakliga områden:
   

  

* Språkmodeller Utveckla lösningar som använder språkmodeller och agentteknik för att förstå användarens behov, identifiera relevant information och fatta beslut kring hur denna information ska användas. Du arbetar med tekniker som retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), prompt engineering och agentramverk för att skapa kraftfulla och användarvänliga AI-drivna upplevelser.
* Databearbetning Bygg skalbara och robusta datapipelines som gör det möjligt för användare att ladda upp filer och extrahera relevant information. Du ansvarar för att konvertera, strukturera och lagra data i olika former, exempelvis objektlagring, vektor- eller grafdatabaser, samt bygga integrationer mot andra system för att tillgängliggöra information.
* Operationalisering Säkerställ att våra generativa AI-lösningar är robusta, säkra och skalbara i praktiken. Det innebär att hantera hela driftsättningen och livscykelhanteringen av plattformarna - från övervakning och felsökning till prestandaoptimering och rättighetshantering. Du ser till att lösningarna uppfyller de höga krav på säkerhet och dataskydd som gäller inom finansiell verksamhet och skapar förutsättningar för god observerbarhet.


**Vår teknikstack**
* Språk: Python, Javascript, Typescript
* Databaser: MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Redis
* Frontend: React.js, Tailwind, DaisyUI
* API Gateway: Nginx
* Plattform: Azure Container Apps – planeras för Kubernetes
* Backend: FastAPI, Celery
* Lokal utvecklingsmiljö: Docker Compose, WSL, VS Code med GitHub Copilot
* CI/CD: Azure DevOps
* IaC: Bicep


 Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av backendutveckling, särskilt i Python och gärna FastAPI för att bygga API:er.
* Kunskap om databaser som MongoDB och PostgreSQL.
* Erfarenhet av molnplattformar, gärna Azure, samt containerlösningar som Kubernetes.
* Vana av CI/CD och DevOps-arbete, gärna med Azure DevOps eller liknande plattformar.
* Förmåga att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team och kommunicera lösningar både tekniskt och icke-tekniskt.


 Meriterande är även om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av Celery och asynkron programmering.
* Kunskap om vektor- och grafdatabaser.
* Grundläggande kunskaper i React.js och Tailwind CSS.
* Erfarenhet av infrastruktur som kod (IaC), exempelvis Bicep.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av att integrera LLMs i olika lösningar.


 Som person är du nyfiken, självgående och har ett stort intresse för att skapa helhetslösningar. Du trivs med att arbeta i en dynamisk och innovativ miljö, är samarbetsvillig och vill ständigt utvecklas inom olika delar av teknikstacken. Du har lätt för att se helheten och gillar att bidra till att bygga framtidens lösningar tillsammans med andra.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Vi står inför en omfattande utveckling inom data och AI – ett initiativ som kommer att påverka både vår organisation och vår bransch under lång tid framöver. Just nu bygger vi ett AI center of excellence, där vi tar fram gemensamma plattformar och riktlinjer för hela Länsförsäkringsgruppen, driver på användningen av nya AI-lösningar och säkerställer återanvändbarhet. Genom detta center stärker vi både lokal innovation och gemensamt lärande, samtidigt som vi ökar kunskap och kompetens i hela organisationen.
   

  

 Som AI-arkitekt tillhör du vår avdelning Data & AI, men får också breda kontaktytor över hela Länsförsäkringar. Vi är ett av Sveriges ledande företag inom bank, försäkring och fondliv, och vi satsar stort på digitalisering och innovation. Här får du möjlighet att växa och utvecklas tillsammans med engagerade kollegor, samtidigt som du bidrar till att stärka hela vår affär.
   

  

 Kontaktuppgifter
   

  

 Rekryterande chef: mattias.karlsson1@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

 Facklig representant Forena: jessica.loow@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

 Facklig representant Akademikerföreningen: lisa-maria.carensjo@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

**Vi vill informera dig som söker tjänst hos oss att vi under jul- och nyårshelgerna har begränsad bemanning. Det kan därför dröja något längre än vanligt innan du får återkoppling från oss. Vi tackar för din förståelse och ser fram emot att återkomma till dig så snart som möjligt efter julledigheten.
   

  

 God jul och gott nytt år!**
 Länsförsäkringar AB är en inkluderande arbetsplats där mod, möjligheter och engagemang står i centrum. Vi erbjuder ett hållbart arbetsliv med flexibla villkor och satsar på att alla medarbetare ska kunna växa och trivas, oavsett bakgrund.
   

  

 Digital & IT är hjärtat i Länsförsäkringsgruppens digitala utveckling. Vi driver den gemensamma digitala transformationen och levererar förstklassiga IT-lösningar, datadrivna insikter och innovativa digitala tjänster som skapar värde för hela verksamheten. Vårt uppdrag är att bygga en robust och framtidssäker IT-miljö – både på plats och i molnet – som möjliggör kundnära och effektiva affärer i hela gruppen.
   

  

 Hos oss möts teknik, affär och innovation. Vi arbetar tvärfunktionellt ute i verksamheten i agila team där utveckling, drift och strategi går hand i hand. Vi ansvarar för allt från IT-styrning, enterprisearkitektur och leverantörshantering till applikationsutveckling, cybersäkerhet och verksamhetsberedskap.

title: Senior Fullstack Developer
description:
**Location:** 
 Stockholm, City (HQ)
   

  

**Type:** 
 Full-time, On-site
   

  

**The Energy Market is Broken. You Will Help Us Fix It.**
 Elvy was founded on a simple idea: homeowners shouldn't have to be engineers or millionaires to have a sustainable home. What Spotify did for music we do for energy, turning a complex, expensive ownership model into a seamless, worry-free subscription.
   

  

 We install solar panels, a heat pump, and a battery system with zero investment required for the customer. The homeowner gets a fixed monthly price including all energy consumption and peace of mind for 15 years.
   

  

 We are in the midst of closing our Series A, recently secured significant debt financing to scale, and proven the model in Sweden. Now, we are entering an intense growth phase.
   

  

**Senior Fullstack Developer**
**The Opportunity**
 We are looking for a Senior Fullstack Developer, who will engage in developing new exciting features based on JS/Python/Dart/Flutter. Reporting to the CTO. You will collaborate closely with other members of the company and a diverse tech team.
   

  

**Potential width of cases**
* Build a completely new integration to a new energy production stack, with AI prognostic features and real-time monitoring
* Integrate AI Agents within business flows
* Develop a realtime communications mobile and desktop-app with webrtp-like features
* Enhance Baysian Probabilistic model with more parameters and clustering
* Refactoring existing working features with more scalability, flexibility and maintainability.
* Drive quick POC's, MVP's with real adoption probability
* Connect directly to hardware and get sensor data, and set energy loads over time


**Who You Are**
* 3+ years of experience of docker, terraform, vercel, gcp and multistage environments
* 2+ years of experience of managing a dev/test/production environment
* 3+ years as a fullstack engineer engaged in real world projects.
* Agile way of working - create/break down tickets, work in multiple teams
* Thrive in a fast-paced startup environment and improve the way of working and sharing knowledge
* Excellent communicator and relationship builder
* Preferably fluent in both Swedish and English
* Nice to have: experience with AI, Agents/Operators and integration to “off-the-shelf” systems (Monday,Hubspot, Airtable)


**Why Join Elvy?**
* We have product-market fit, simplifying the lives of homeowners by installing systems daily,
* You will make a real impact for both the company and the lives of our customers.
* You will work alongside experienced founders and colleagues who are obsessed with excellence and speed, in our Stockholm city office.


**Interested?** 
 Apply today by sending your CV, LinkedIn profile and a short motivation for why you are right for Elvy and this role.

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
**THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELL**
**You?** 
 A strategic and outcome-driven product leader who thrives at the intersection of user experience, commercial value, and technical complexity.
   

  

**Role?** 
 Lead the delivery of
 **Vend’s next-generation new-car experience** 
 , connecting buyers, OEMs, and dealers through trusted, AI-powered, data-driven solutions. As AI reshapes how people discover and choose cars, your role is to turn these capabilities into meaningful product experiences and make AI a core differentiator across the entire journey.
   

  

**Company?** 
**Vend** 
 — home to FINN, Blocket, DBA, Tori, Oikotie, and Bilbasen — helping millions across the Nordics make smart choices every day.
   

  

**Location?** 
 Join us in our central and modern
 **Stockholm** 
 or
 **Oslo** 
 office with the flexibility to work 50% remotely - your choice, your balance.
   

  

**Why us?** 
 This is your chance to
 **shape how people buy new cars** 
 and help OEMs succeed in digital marketplaces - by creating trusted connections that drive real results.
   

  

**What The Role Is About**
 This role sits within Vend Mobility, a 250-strong team of experts across the Nordics driven to help people make smarter mobility choices.
   

  

 You’ll lead the product success of
 **Vend’s New Car Initiative,** 
 taking it from pilot to full scale across Blocket, FINN, and Bilbasen.
   

  

**Your mission:** 
 Make it easy for people to find the right car and form of ownership, connecting them seamlessly with OEMs and dealers, and creating real value for our partners.
   

  

**Your Week Might Include**
* Leading the cross-functional New Car team through discovery, delivery, and iteration
* Turning user and partner insights into clear hypotheses, experiments, and validated outcomes
* Actively driving the commercial agenda, defining how we monetize the value we deliver
* Defining and refining the key pillars of the new-car experience together with tech and UX
* Aligning with core marketplace experience, Pro area, and Advertising teams
* Identifying and prioritising opportunities where AI can strengthen user discovery, matching, and decision-support, working closely with design, data science, and engineering
* Managing OEM and cross-functional dependencies across product, tech strategy, marketing, and sales
* Partnering with Marketing and Sales to ensure go-to-market readiness and measurable business impact
* Tracking and optimising for engagement, lead quality, conversion, and partner satisfaction


**SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE**
**After 6 months:** 
 You’ve translated learnings from our pilot and defined a solid launch plan for Blocket and FINN. The product strategy is validated, and we are on track to meet our commercial ambitions for 2026.
   

  

**After 12 months:** 
 Vend’s New Car initiative has launched successfully, showing strong user engagement, high-quality leads, and proven commercial value, and with a clear path for further scaling.
   

  

**Who You Are**
* You’re a seasoned product manager who thrives on turning strategy into results, able to lead complex, cross-team initiatives that deliver measurable business impact


**You Know How To**
* Translate vision into action through clear strategy, roadmaps, and measurable outcomes
* Drive alignment across teams with empathy and influence, not hierarchy
* Combine data-driven rigour with strong product intuition
* Communicate complex ideas simply to engineers, executives, and external partners
* Balance creating value for users/customers and monetizing this value
* Confident in applying AI in product development, you want to lead how to turn AI capabilities into tangible user and business value


**Preferred Experience**
* 5+ years in product management or similar strategic product roles
* Background in marketplaces or automotive ecosystems is a strong plus
* Strong analytical grounding, you are comfortable with experimentation, KPIs, and tools like Amplitude, Tableau, or Looker
* Experience working with AI-driven user experiences is a strong plus
* Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams and manage stakeholders effectively
* Excellent written and spoken English; knowing Nordic languages is a plus


**THE CHALLENGE TO TURN INTO AN OPPORTUNITY**
 The automotive world is shifting from showrooms to digital ecosystems. Your challenge? Build trust with buyers, OEMs, and dealers while defining a sustainable, AI-enabled business model that connects inspiration, discovery, and conversion in one seamless experience.
   

  

**A FEW WORDS FROM YOUR FUTURE MANAGER**
 “Welcome to the Private Buyer area in Mobility. We’re changing how people find, buy, or lease cars, now also focusing on new cars. We believe in empowerment and autonomy, combined with clear accountability. And we love seeing our area and the people in it grow.”
   

  

 —
 *Morten Frydendal, Product Director Mobility*
**GOT YOU ATTENTION?**
 The latest date to apply is
 **January 11th** 
 ; we’re looking forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 Cecilia Bergerståhl, Senior TA Partner, is happy to provide information together with Morten Frydendal, Product Director Mobility, about the daily work and answer any questions you may have!
   

  

 Want to get a feel for our culture and what drives us?
   

  

 👉 Take a peek behind the scenes at our Career Page!
   

  

*Please note that, due to the upcoming holidays, we won’t begin processing candidates until January.*

title: Solution Sales Specialist
description:
*Would you like to become a Solution sales specialist – a lighthouse within complex and secure network solutions?*
**About Your Role and The Team**
 We are looking for a Solution Sales Specialist with a strong commercial mindset to support and drive sales within complex network solutions and cybersecurity, in collaboration with the key account managers.
   

  

 Inviting you to be a part of an international organization, with business within the Nordics, Finland, and Germany and part of a newly established Pan-Nordic team, within our B2B business unit, GlobalConnect is investing in a strengthened network and security position to enable further growth in our portfolio of connectivity products, as a managed service provider.
   

  

 GlobalConnect is owned by EQT where we continuously deliver on high growth ambitions, acting as a challenger and acting as a frontrunner within being a managed service provider. Furthermore, we offer a dynamic work environment in a Pan-Nordic matrix organization.
   

  

 In this role, you will work closely with our sales teams to enhance their ability to sell complex network solutions with starting point in SD-WAN and Managed LAN and Wi-Fi, combined with security products and services. Furthermore, you will play a key role in shaping our cybersecurity sales strategy and be a valued and important stakeholder in our product development.
   

  

**Here are some examples of key responsibilities during a typical day:**
* Act as a trusted advisor for the sales team, providing expertise within network solutions and ensure the sales team can confidently pitch GlobalConnects network and security products.
* Creating pipeline and maturing customer leads by being highly frequent participating in customer meetings where you will be a driving force and act as technical and commercial lighthouse in customer meetings
* Develop and conceptualize GlobalConnects way of selling cybersecurity and complex network solutions as a service.
* Support the creation of customer proposals, presentations, and high-level solution designs in collaboration with pre-sales teams.
* Engage with customers to understand their security challenges and business needs, helping to tailor the right solutions – and how to tailor the message.
* Stay updated on industry trends, competitor offerings, and emerging security technologies to provide strategic guidance.


**Who We Are Looking For**
 The ideal candidate for this role has commercial firepower and deep product knowledge within LAN, WAN, Wi-Fi, DDOS, Firewall, SOC and NAC – and can navigate within a multi-vendor setup.
   

  

 With flair and comfort throughout the sales process, you drive meetings with a communication range, going from being a storytelling ‘network-evangelist’ to answering technical security questions specific to GlobalConnect network products.
   

  

 You use your knowledge within large account solutions to support sales by enabling them with expert guidance, driving customer meetings and support in complex sales situations.
   

  

 You excel at translating technical customer needs into clear, compelling messages that resonate with customers – from C-level to network managers. As a collaborative team player, you take pride in coaching and developing sales teams, ensuring they have the confidence and knowledge to position GlobalConnect’s solutions effectively.
   

  

 Building strong relationships comes naturally to you, both within the organization and with external customers. Your strategic mindset allows them to position our connectivity solutions within a broader IT infrastructure perspective, ensuring alignment with business objectives and customer needs.
   

  

 You might have a background from a large vendor or a Service Integrator, but other backgrounds are highly relevant as well.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe you have:**
* Proven industry experience within sales, pre-sales, or solution consulting.
* Structured mind, making sure to plan for sufficient activity levels and being capable of prioritizing sales effort to be efficient.
* Open minded to enter a Managed Service Provider with multi-vendor setup (e.g., Versa, Aruba, Cisco, Fortinet, etc.) and ideally experience with these.
* Experience working with sales teams and a desire to enhance their network and cybersecurity knowledge and capabilities.
* Excellent presentation and communication skills in English and ideally one or more of the Scandinavian languages.


 If you find it compelling to serve as trusted advisors to customers and internal sales teams, we offer a key role in shaping the future of GlobalConnects sales approach where you will be the one bridging technical solutions with business value.
   

  

**No need for a personal letter** 
 – just send us your CV or LinkedIn profile!
   

  

**About Us**
 GlobalConnect is one of the leading connectivity providers in Northern Europe. We’re 2000 passionate and talented individuals who want to make a difference, turning our customers’ visions into reality through connectivity. Our goal is to create the best possible conditions for engaged employees, a place where you can develop and grow, and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
   

  

 We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.

title: Delivery Manager
description:
Vi söker en Delivery Manager som vill bli en del av oss på Telia.
   

  

 Jag heter
 **Annika Sjögren Marz** 
 ,
 **Head of Mobile Sites & Customized Solutions** 
 , och jag letar efter någon som vill växa tillsammans med oss. Vi är ett stöttande och framtidsinriktat team som fokuserar på att leverera mobilnätsspeciallösningar och operatörsgemensamma lösningar för att säkra Telias nätledarskap i Sverige.
   

  

**Vad du kommer att göra:**
 Som Delivery Manager inom Mobilnätsenheten ansvarar du för komplexa leveranser och säkerställer att kundlösningar levereras enligt tidplan. Du arbetar nära vår Delivery Manager Coordinator och företräder Telia affärsmässigt i samarbeten med flera parter.
   

  

* Hantera stora och komplexa kundleveranser från start till överlämning
* Säkerställa entreprenadarbeten och att kundens behov möts
* Följa upp hårdvaruleveranser och ekonomi i varje projekt
* Utveckla och effektivisera arbetssätt samt digitalisera där det är möjligt


**För att lyckas i rollen:**
 Du är ansvarstagande, kommunikativ och trivs med att bygga relationer. Du är lösningsorienterad, stresstålig och målinriktad.
   

  

* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av IT, telekom eller mobila tjänster
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet i projektledning och leveransarbete
* Förmåga att prioritera och driva komplexa projekt
* Flytande i svenska och engelska


**Var med och forma ett smartare liv för människor, företag och planeten**
 På Telia är vi ett team med 15 000 kollegor i Norden och Baltikum, passionerade kring teknik och uppkoppling. Som ledande telekomoperatör och klimatförebild driver vi förändring genom storskaliga, effektfulla projekt – samtidigt som vi bygger en hållbar och inkluderande värld. Här får du möjlighet att utveckla dina färdigheter, leda meningsfulla projekt och trivas i en stöttande och mångsidig miljö.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 När du börjar hos oss får du ett omfattande förmånspaket anpassat efter din lokala marknad, möjlighet till hybridarbete och mer. Du har också chans att få bonus baserat på din prestation och Telias resultat.
   

  

**Låter det intressant?**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan senast
 **2026-01-11** 
 . Nu går vi in i en period av julledighet och kommer att gå igenom alla ansökningar efter sista ansökningsdatum.
   

  

 Om du går vidare kontaktas du av vår Talent Acquisition Partner.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer? Kontakta
 **Annika Marz-Sjögren** 
 på
 **annika.marz-sjogren@teliacompany.com** 
 .
   

  

**Lika möjligheter för alla**
 På Telia värderar vi kompetens och utvecklingspotential. Vi främjar mångfald och ser till att varje individs behov tillgodoses, oavsett funktionsvariation, kön, ålder, sexuell läggning eller social bakgrund.
   

  

***Telia är en del av Sveriges kritiska infrastruktur och delar av vår verksamhet omfattas av lagstiftning om säkerhetsskydd. Innan anställning kan ske krävs godkänd säkerhetsprövning***
 Join us and let’s make better happen – together!

title: PEOPLE ADMINISTRATION SPECIALIST
description:
People / HR Administrator
   

  

 Become a part of our People Services Administration Team!
   

  

 SAS is on an exciting journey of change and in a digital transformation within the People organization. We have come a long way but want to continue to create efficient processes and smooth administrative work.
   

  

**Challenges You Will Work On**
 Provide administrative support across the employee lifecycle, ensuring accurate data handling, contract management, and coordination of employment-related processes across Sweden, Denmark, Norway & UK and support queries from the organization.
   

  

**Employee Lifecycle & Contract Management**
 Create, update, and upload employment contracts for various employment types.
   

  

 Register and check data quality for new hires and employee changes
   

  

 Generate Work certificates
   

  

 Upload documents to digital personnel files
   

  

**Compliance & GDPR**
 Handle GDPR-related requests and ensure secure data management
   

  

 Keep to the process to assure audit trails
   

  

 Process Development & Support
   

  

**Other**
 Participate in process mapping, testing, and improvement initiatives.
   

  

 Maintain and update guides and documentation for recurring tasks.
   

  

 Collaborate with different stakeholders to improve workflow
   

  

 Always have the Scandinavian perspective when doing improvements or changes
   

  

 The Team
   

  

 You will be part of a high-performing and diverse team composed of talented professionals from various backgrounds. Our team values collaboration, innovation, and commitment to professionalism. We support each other and thrive on creating a positive and inclusive work environment.
   

  

 To be successful, we believe you have
   

  

* University education or UAS education in HR, IT, Systems Science, Administration, Payroll…
* You have at least 1-3 years of experience in administration, preferably in the HR area, but not a requirement
* It is a merit if you have experience with SuccessFactor / SAP (Employee Central)
* Other systems we work with are OpenText (document management) and Service Now.
* You should have good knowledge of Office 365 and have generally good system experience and be interested in learning new systems.
* An important quality is to be meticulous, but also to be able to handle a high pace with a high workload for short periods during the year.
* You should enjoy performing repetitive tasks and providing support to your colleagues


**As a Person, We Believe That You Are**
 Service-minded, curious, responsible and committed. And you have a drive to get things done! We work purposefully and passionately with our culture at SAS, and this is something we look at a lot when we recruit.
   

  

 Why SAS?
   

  

 At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:
   

  

* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.


  

  

**Our Culture at SAS**
 At SAS, we are dedicated to caring for each other, delighting our travelers, and driving the transformation towards sustainable aviation. As a future colleague on our team, you’ll join a culture where we work collaboratively towards common goals, recognize each other's contributions, and celebrate successes. Our focus is on safe, sustainable, and punctual execution, and we are committed to protecting our planet while transforming SAS for the future. This is an empowering workplace where you can thrive, grow, and take ownership of your work. Join us at SAS and be part of shaping the future of aviation!
   

  

 Additional information
   

  

 Deadline for application: January 18, 2026. Please send us your CV as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR regulations.
   

  

 Desired start date: February 1, 2026
   

  

 Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6-month probation period
   

  

 This position is based in Frösundavik, Solna (Stockholm), and you will be expected to work onsite. Remote work is possible less than 50% of the time. There might be some travel involved, mainly to Denmark and Norway, and you will also work remote from Arlanda from time to time.
   

  

 A background check will be conducted at the final stage of this recruitment process, as this role is security classified. If you are aware of any specific matters that may come up during this background check, we kindly ask you to be transparent about them during the recruitment process.
   

  

  

  

 If you have questions about this position, you are welcome to contact Fredrik Jangendal, Talent Aqusition Specialist via email: fredrik.jangendal@sas.se.
 ***Please note that due to the Christmas and New Year holidays, response times may be longer than usual.***

title: Talent Acquisition Partner
description:
Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech bank dedicated to powering entrepreneurs. In just 10 years, we’ve grown from a startup to hitting 1 billion SEK in annual revenue. We’ve combined technology, data, and deep market insight to create fair and accessible financing for small businesses. To continue our growth journey, we’re now looking for a Talent Acquisition Partner who wants to take on a crucial role in building the teams that shape Qred’s future.
   

  

 If you get excited about taking initiative, partnering closely with the business, and raising the bar for recruitment quality - this is the place for you.
   

  

**The role**
 The right talent is key to our success and in this role you’ll be instrumental in finding, attracting, and selecting the people who are the heart of our business. Our biggest teams today are Tech and Customer Success, but we’re pretty much growing in all functions so you can expect variety in both roles and seniority levels. You’ll own the full-cycle recruitment, work closely with engaged hiring managers, bring a structured point of view, and shape processes that lead to high-quality hiring decisions.
   

  

**Your responsibilities will include:**
* Running end-to-end recruitment processes within a broad variety of roles
* Proactively sourcing and building pipelines using different tools and methods
* Partnering with hiring managers to understand business needs and define role requirements
* Conducting interviews, assessing competencies, and validating cultural fit
* Improving recruitment workflows, tools, and decision-making frameworks
* Supporting in employer branding and continuously enhancing candidate experience


 You’ll partner closely with our Talent Acquisition Partner, report to our CHRO, and work hand in hand with a highly collaborative HR team that plays a crucial part in shaping and accelerating Qred’s growth. We are a team that has each other’s backs, believes in continuous learning, and challenges ourselves to get better every day - and of course having fun while we do it!
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You thrive in a dynamic scale-up environment where structure and speed go hand in hand. You are confident in running processes independently, curious about the business behind the roles you recruit for, and motivated by delivering high-quality outcomes.
   

  

 We believe you bring:
   

  

* 2-4 years of hands-on recruitment experience, ideally within tech
* Strong sourcing skills and experience in building targeted pipelines
* Ability to operate in a fast-moving scale-up environment
* A self-driven, structured, and proactive way of working
* Clear communication skills - you ask questions early and seek clarity when needed
* An interest in AI and how new tools can elevate recruitment (interest matters more than experience)
* Fluency in English, Swedish is considered a plus


**Why join us?**
 This is a unique opportunity to be a crucial part of a growing fintech company that is redefining financial services for small businesses in Northern Europe. You'll work in a high pace environment where ideas move fast and ownership is expected.
   

  

**One last thing**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.
   

  

 Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.
   

  

 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: Platform Engineer
description:
We are the newly established Data Platform Services team within Telia Technology Analytics Platforms unit. Our mission is to deliver top-tier, purpose-built, and value-driven capabilities in Data and AI to Telia. We believe that enhancing analytical capabilities is crucial for boosting Telia’s operational efficiency, improving our product offerings, and elevating customer experience. To accomplish this, we provide a unified set of tools designed to meet the needs of every country.
   

  

 My name is Mikko Olin, Head of Data Platform Services, and I am seeking team member who is enthusiastic about collaborating closely with our on-premises open-source data Lakehouse, Arcus, in Sweden. Arcus is our next-generation analytics platform, enabling in-country analytics with Lakehouse capabilities. It is built entirely on open-source technology with dedicated hardware and extensive GPU computing power. Our latest iteration supports near real-time use cases, ML Ops, relational databases (Postgres), and GenAI.
   

  

**Is this you?**
 You excel at analyzing complex problems, articulating suggested solutions, developing them, and collaborating with colleagues when needed. You take ownership of your responsibilities and are an excellent communicator.
   

  

**Your personality:**
* Team player
* Self-motivated with learning mindset
* Understand business value and demonstrate it in implemented solutions
* Good storytelling skills


**We would like you to have experience from some of the below:**
* Python
* Managing Kubernetes deployments and infrastructure
* Experience with Apache Spark, Apache Airflow and Trino
* IAC using Helm and Ansible
* Setting up CI/CD pipelines
* GitHub & GitHub Actions


**Bonus if you also have experience from:**
* Setting up data analytics platforms using cloud native components in Kubernetes
* Nvidia AI stack
* DBT (data build tool)
* Data warehouse & analytics background


**We are more than a workplace**
 Join Telia and our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn a bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.
   

  

**Interested?**
 If you fancy joining our team, don’t hesitate to apply! If you want to know more about the job, reach out to Mikko Olin, mikko.olin@teliacompany.com
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application and to make sure that your personal data is kept safely, we kindly ask you to apply through our recruitment system. We are not able to handle resumes via e-mail or equivalent. Selection will take place on an ongoing basis and this position might be filled before the application deadline.
 **Application deadline is 2026-01-08**
**Join us and let's make better happen - together!**

title: Teamledande Scrum Master
description:
Vill du utvecklas som ledare samtidigt som du är med och bidrar till säkra och effektiva it-tjänster hos flera av Sveriges samhällsviktiga myndigheter? Sök då rollen som teamledande Scrum Master och var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 I din roll som teamledande Scrum Master leder du ett agilt team som arbetar enligt SAFe-ramverket. Du har det övergripande ansvaret för teamets leverans enligt uppdrag, mål och plan och säkerställer värde utifrån kundens behov. Du sätter den dagliga prioriteringen för teamet och håller i agila ceremonier så som retroperspektiv och demos. Vidare utvecklar du arbetssätt och driver en kultur som främjar kontinuerliga förbättringar. I dina arbetsuppgifter ingår även uppföljning av kapacitet, leverans och drift samt att stötta i att undanröja hinder som teamet inte kan lösa själva. Du arbetar dessutom med beredskapsplanering och dokumentation kring exempelvis teamkort, utförargrupper och driftinstruktioner.
   

  

 Du är placerad i Sundbyberg och är en del av enheten Skatteverkets Tekniska Tjänster (STT). Vi ansvarar för utveckling, underhåll och drift och levererar tjänster inom it infrastruktur, plattformar och it arbetsplats till flera myndigheter: Skatteverket, Kronofogden, Valmyndigheten, Utbetalningsmyndigheten samt Myndigheten för Digital förvaltning. Vi har dessutom fått uppdraget att leverera it-tjänster till ännu fler myndigheter!
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjlighet till ständig utveckling och lärande i arbetet. Tack vare att vi är en stor it-organisation med cirka 1500 medarbetare kan vi erbjuda goda möjligheter till intern rörlighet. Det är viktigt för oss att du har balans mellan jobb och fritid och vi erbjuder bland annat flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet att jobba delvis hemifrån. Skatteverkets it-avdelning arbetar aktivt för att främja en inkluderande arbetsplats som präglas av jämställdhet och mångfald där alla medarbetare får lika möjligheter att bidra och utvecklas. Läs mer på Jobba med IT hos oss | Skatteverket.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår Skatteverkets medarbetarpolicy | Skatteverket.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* ha god samarbetsförmåga och bidra till ett positivt arbetsklimat för att nå gemensamma mål
* kunna arbeta självständigt, planera och driva arbetet framåt
* vara mål -och resultatorienterad och känna ansvar för att leverera bästa möjliga resultat
* ha god problemlösningsförmåga, se mönster och kunna göra avgränsningar
* vara tydlig i din kommunikation och säkerställa att budskap når fram och att förväntningarna är klara för alla
* uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska.


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* eftergymnasial utbildning inom it alternativt arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer relevant
* flerårig, aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av en ledande roll inom it-området
* flerårig, aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av att arbeta agilt.


 Det är önskvärt att du har arbetat som Scrum Master tidigare samt att du arbetat enligt SAFe och/eller ITIL. Det är även önskvärt med aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av Jira och Confluence. Slutligen är det önskvärt att du har aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av ServiceNow.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På Jobba hos oss | Skatteverket kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Ansvariga kontaktpersoner har begränsad tillgänglighet under semesterperioden. Om du önskar komma i kontakt med någon av oss, maila oss gärna så hjälper vi dig vidare. Intervjuer planeras att genomföras mellan vecka 4 och 6. Dessa datum kan komma att ändras.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/853 | Kontakt: Peter Schneider, Rekryterande chef peter.schneider@skatteverket.se, Klara Hallsenius, Hr-specialist rekrytering klara.hallsenius@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, Therese Sjödin, Seko therese.sjodin@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2025-12-17 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2026-01-07

title: Solutions Engineer, Splunk
description:
**Meet the Team**
 Splunk, a Cisco company, is building a safer and more resilient digital world with an end-to-end full stack platform made for a hybrid, multi-cloud world. Leading enterprises use our unified security and observability platform to keep their digital systems secure and reliable. Our customers love our technology, but it's our caring employees that make Splunk stand out as an amazing career destination. No matter where in the world or what level of the organization, we approach our work with kindness. So bring your work experience, problem-solving skills and talent, of course, but also bring your joy, your passion and all the things that make you, you. Come help organizations be their best, while you reach new heights with a team that has your back.
   

  

**Your Impact**
 This is an opportunity to work at a company that is changing the way information supports business decisions. At Splunk, we've grown rapidly across Europe by helping leading companies (including 90 of the Fortune 100) go from data to business outcomes faster than ever.
   

  

 Now, with the combined strength of Cisco and Splunk, we are accelerating innovation in AI-driven analytics and security, empowering customers to unlock even greater value from their data. Together, we are shaping the future of data and AI to solve complex business challenges at scale.
   

  

 Join us on our journey as Splunk Solutions Engineer, and enjoy a culture of inclusiveness, disruption, and fun while selling smart and winning big.
   

  

**Role Description**
* You will technically own, discover, position, prove and deliver the key technical elements of a sales cycle to achieve a ‘technical win’ within medium to large scale and complex customer environments. You’ll use a range of communication styles, a range of technology skills and experiences and a range of soft skills and people skills to develop trust relationships with both your sales colleagues and your customers.
* You will be an advocate and ambassador for Splunk through your professional social media, industry and marketing events and supporting pipeline generation activities
* You will collaborate with your customer contacts, and build them into Splunk champions, by helping them to understand how Splunk can help them to solve some of their most challenging problems and help them achieve their objectives.


**Responsibilities**
* Ability to demonstrate Splunk products and services to customers on site, remotely via webinar sessions, and at field events such as conferences and trade shows.
* Establish and maintain strong relationships throughout the sales cycle with all levels within the customer.
* Willing to travel to visit prospects and customers, and to engage in onsite customer work when required.
* Answer complex technical and competitive questions plus address customer concerns to a successful outcome.
* You should have experience with discovering pain and determining value with customers.
* You should be comfortable working for a dynamic technical organization with a rapidly expanding customer base.
* Collaborating with multiple Account Managers to explore opportunities simultaneously, driving discovery calls, and evaluating each prospect to identify the most promising next steps.


**Do these characteristics describe YOU?**
* Curiosity: You tend to want to understand the why of a scenario as much as the what and typically use a range of skills to discover whether the first response to the question really describes the situation or its implications
* Customer Success: Selling is great, but customers being successful with your solutions is one of your main motivations.
* Technically Astute: You enjoy the detail, even if you don’t always need to express it. You have a thirst for up-to-date knowledge of the technologies and solutions that businesses use to be successful as they transform.
* Confidence: But not arrogant – you have the confidence that comes from the knowledge that your product is rock solid, and the ability to transmit this confidence to a customer. That means you might sit down with a customer already using your product to show them how they might use it even better!
* Business Savvy: You understand how businesses are organized, how they achieve their desired results, what challenges they are likely to face, what solutions they need and what transformations they could make with your solutions.
* A growth mindset: You build in time to develop your skills, knowledge, experience or capabilities. You look beyond the current opportunity towards the wider set of opportunities that could exist in a prospect.
* A Collaborator: You understand that selling is a team game, so you spend time developing your network of colleagues and partners to achieve your success – and theirs.
* Competitive: If you’re in it, you want to win it!
* Fun: Getting the job done and enjoying & generating fun don’t need to be mutually exclusive.
* The candidate must be based in Sweden and be fluent in Swedish and English.


**Helpful technical skills or experience (not all required, but consider how Splunk could benefit from your background)**
* Domain knowledge and experience in IT infrastructure, Cloud Technologies, Application Delivery, Business Analytics, Log Management, Observability, and IT Security
* Insights in IT Operations: Experience with ITSM tools and ITIL processes such as incident, problem, and change
* Understanding of IT Monitoring, Security Monitoring, and Observability—including experience with tools for infrastructure, application performance (APM), and security event monitoring (SIEM) across logs, metrics, and traces
* Modern application architecture (microservices): Understanding or experience with Kubernetes, Docker, and/or Lambda/serverless
* Familiarity with DevOps concepts and hands-on experience in engineering/software development, using modern programming languages such as Java, Python, PHP, .NET, Ruby, js, Go, etc.


 Why Cisco?
   

  

 At Cisco, we’re revolutionizing how data and infrastructure connect and protect organizations in the AI era – and beyond. We’ve been innovating fearlessly for 40 years to create solutions that power how humans and technology work together across the physical and digital worlds. These solutions provide customers with unparalleled security, visibility, and insights across the entire digital footprint.
   

  

 Fueled by the depth and breadth of our technology, we experiment and create meaningful solutions. Add to that our worldwide network of doers and experts, and you’ll see that the opportunities to grow and build are limitless. We work as a team, collaborating with empathy to make really big things happen on a global scale. Because our solutions are everywhere, our impact is everywhere.
   

  

 We are Cisco, and our power starts with you.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**Build something monumental for Healthcare!**
 At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.
   

  

 We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!
   

  

**About The Role**
 You care about data that actually works - data that’s reliable, well-modeled, and trusted by the people who use it. In previous roles, you were the person who made pipelines stable, clarified messy data models, and helped teams move from “we think” to “we know.”
   

  

 You enjoy building systems that quietly do their job, day after day. At Tandem, you’ll bring that mindset to a fast-growing healthtech company building AI-powered tools for clinicians across Europe. As a Senior Data Engineer, you’ll be responsible for designing and maintaining the data foundations that power our products, analytics, and decision-making.
   

  

 You’ll join a small but ambitious data team, working closely with product and engineering teams to ensure our data is accurate, accessible, and ready to scale, without sacrificing quality or trust.This is a role for someone who enjoys ownership, likes solving real-world data problems, and wants their work to have tangible impact in a highly meaningful domain.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines that ingest, transform, and serve data across Tandem’s systems.
* Own and evolve our data models, ensuring they are clear, reliable, and easy to work with for analytics, product, and ML use cases.
* Work closely with product and engineering teams to support data-driven features, reporting, and insights.
* Ensure data quality through testing, monitoring, and clear ownership of datasets.
* Help scale our data infrastructure to support increasing volume, complexity, and new markets.
* Collaborate with engineering teams to ensure data is structured and accessible for training, evaluation, and production use.
* Contribute to best practices around documentation, lineage, and governance, making data understandable and trustworthy.


**What You Bring**
* Strong experience as a Data Engineer working with production data systems in a modern tech environment.
* Solid understanding of data modeling, ETL/ELT pipelines, and analytical workflows.
* Experience working with cloud data platforms (e.g. BigQuery, Snowflake, Redshift, Databricks).
* Experience with streaming or event-based data (e.g. Kafka, CDC pipelines).
* Experience with data orchestration tools (Airflow, Argo Workflows, etc.)
* Comfortable writing production-grade code (e.g. Python, SQL) and collaborating closely with software engineers.
* A pragmatic mindset - you know when to optimize and when to keep things simple.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to work across teams with different needs and levels of technical depth.
* A genuine interest in building systems that are reliable, maintainable, and used by others.


**Bonus Points**
* Familiarity with analytics engineering tools (dbt or similar).
* Experience working with data in regulated environments (healthcare, fintech, govtech).
* Exposure to ML or AI data workflows, feature stores, or model monitoring.
* Experience setting up data quality checks, observability, or governance frameworks.


**Culture at Tandem**
 At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.
   

  

 Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.
   

  

 Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.
   

  

 We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.
   

  

*Tandem handles sensitive patient data and will conduct a background check before hiring any candidate.*

title: Director of Business Development
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 We are looking for a
 **Director of Business Development** 
 to lead strategic initiatives and business development at Mentimeter. In this role you will help shape the company’s future by leading our strategic processes & initiatives as well exploring new avenues for growth.
   

  

 You will report to the COO whilst working closely with our CEO and other members of the Management Team. You will lead a small but highly impactful Business Development team, while also collaborating with leaders across Product, Marketing, Sales, and Finance. This is a highly cross-functional role, with potential to influence Mentimeter’s strategic direction, corporate development, and operational model.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Facilitate and drive Mentimeter’s company-level strategy processes
* Drive the process of evolving Mentimeter’s offering, e.g. ideal customer profiles (ICP), value spaces, and strategic positioning.
* Lead business model development, including monetization strategy and pricing for both self-service and sales-assisted motions.
* Own the M&A process
* Develop and own the framework for evaluating strategic partnerships and alliances, including opportunity sizing and risk analysis.
* Conduct and oversee research on markets, customers, competitors, and macro trends to inform long-term decisions.
* Own the structure and synthesis of competitive landscape analysis.
* Track and interpret shifts in technology, customer behavior, and industry dynamics to shape future-facing strategy (e.g. AI, SaaS trends).
* Lead IPO-related planning and readiness activities in partnership with Finance and Executive stakeholders. Lead IPO process in the event of an IPO.
* Deliver strategic long term projects on request from the CEO
* Facilitate orchestration of company operations & operating model developments
* Act as the Line Manager and Team Lead for the Business Development team, with accountability for performance, engagement, and development.


**We Believe You Have**
* Around 10 years of relevant experience in strategy & business development, ideally in a B2B SaaS or technology-driven company
* Hands-on experience with M&A processes
* Previous experience of working directly towards CEO/COO/CFO
* Previous leadership experience, with a proven ability to lead and develop teams & individuals
* A track record of driving strategic initiatives that have created measurable business impact
* Strong understanding of monetization, pricing, and business model innovation in SaaS and PLG contexts
* Strong collaboration skills (as you will be working with many different functions and people)
* An analytical mindset and an ability to grasp the full picture
* Excellent presentation skills and an ability to explain complex concepts


 📍
 **Location:** 
 This is primarily an on-site role at Mentimeter HQ in Stockholm.
   

  

**💡Our Recruitment Process**
* Alva Labs logical test
* Screening interview
* Business Case (home assignment)
* Competence interview
* Culture interview
* References & Offer


**Not sure you tick every box?** 
 Apply anyway—great matches often come in surprising shapes.
   

  

 At Mentimeter where we currently boast over 50+ different nationalities, you'll be part of a culture that values creativity, innovation, and inclusivity. We believe in supporting our team members' growth and offering them the platform to excel. If you're eager to contribute to our mission and make a significant impact, we'd love to hear from you.
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**AI and Hiring at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter, we believe AI helps us work smarter - but it never replaces the human assessment, curiosity, and personal connection that define our culture and our hiring. We use AI as a sparring partner: to bounce ideas, bring new perspectives, support structure, and make our work more efficient. But the meaning, decisions, and interactions always come from people.
   

  

* AI does not screen or decide on candidates.
* There is no automated filtering, ranking, or decision-making in our recruitment process. Every application is reviewed by a person.
* Hiring teams may use AI to support their work - for example, to structure notes, prepare interview questions, or organize their thinking.


 AI strengthens our work, but it does not define it. At Mentimeter, we’re not building an AI-driven hiring process - we’re building a people-first culture, where technology helps us listen, learn, and grow together.
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun.
