title: Senior Backend Development Engineer
description:
At norbloc, we build ecosystems for the secure sharing of validated data, as well as solutions for financial institutions seeking to digitize and streamline client onboarding and data management processes. Our client portfolio includes government entities and tier-1 financial institutions, reflecting norbloc's trusted partnerships across multiple regions.
   

  

 We are strengthening our Development team as we continue enhancing our KYC platforms and expanding our integrations with external registries and third-party providers. To support this growth, we are seeking a
 **Senior Backend Development Engineer (Integrations)** 
 , reporting to the Development Lead.
   

  

 By joining norbloc, you will have the opportunity to contribute to a pioneering technology that is reshaping how KYC is conducted globally. Our platforms address long-standing industry challenges and enable the creation of entirely new digital ecosystems.
   

  

**Role Description**
 As a Senior Backend Development Engineer, you will design, build, and optimize backend services and integration layers across our platform. The role focuses on scalable microservices, secure API design, external data integrations, and high-performance backend architecture.
   

  

 You will work closely with other backend engineers, QA, and product managers to deliver robust functionality aligned with regulatory and client needs. The ideal candidate has deep backend expertise, strong understanding of distributed systems, and experience working in diverse integration environments.
   

  

**Duties & Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and maintain backend services, microservices, and internal APIs
* Implement and manage integrations with third-party services, government registries, and external systems
* Own API design, data flow, and integration architecture across the platform
* Write clean, efficient, and testable code following modern engineering best practices
* Optimize backend performance, scalability, and security
* Conduct code reviews and provide technical mentorship to peers
* Document system architecture, API specifications, and integration workflows
* Collaborate with QA and DevOps teams to ensure robust deployments and CI/CD automation
* Support troubleshooting and resolution of production issues


**Requirements**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience
* 5+ years of professional backend development experience
* Strong proficiency with Node.js or Java/Spring
* Solid hands-on experience with RESTful APIs, external integrations, and API lifecycle management
* Experience with relational databases (PostgreSQL preferred) and SQL optimization
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, Git workflows, and containerized environments (Docker/Kubernetes)
* Understanding of microservices architectures and distributed systems
* Knowledge of fintech, RegTech, enterprise SaaS, or blockchain-based platforms will be considered an advantage
* Strong problem-solving skills, communication skills, and fluency in English


**Benefits**
* Be part of a friendly, innovative, and ambitious team
* Grow professionally in a pioneering, high-growth environment
* Work directly with world-leading financial institutions and government entities
* Exposure to cutting-edge technologies, architectures, and methodologies
* Competitive compensation package based on experience

title: Full Stack Web Developer
description:
**We’re looking for an accomplished developer with experience in all aspects of building web applications to help us create the best video commerce platform on the market.** 




  





 The Bambuser Research & Development department builds the world’s best video-based shopping solutions, using our pioneering in-house live video platform continuously developed over the last 17 years. We have a long legacy of quality engineering in this space.
 



 As a Bambuser team member, you will have the opportunity to contribute at the forefront of the emerging market that is video commerce. You will have a chance to work both individually and in close collaboration with others on projects in the challenging environment of real-time live video applications. You will join a group of highly skilled engineers including top open source contributors and world-class experts in their respective fields.
 



 Our philosophy is to build robustly, scalably, and securely for the future, emphasizing quality and practicality, without over-engineering. We ship early and often, and learn from our experiences.
 



  





**What you will do** 




 In the role of Full Stack Web Developer, you will develop, deploy, and maintain the frontend and backend of one or more of our web applications in use by millions of people worldwide.
 



 Opportunities to show off your skills will vary across projects, and may include for example: designing the high-performance caching strategies for high-volume APIs, building React applications from scratch, or optimizing GitLab CI/CD deployment pipelines.
 



  





**Who you are** 



* You have at least 5 years working as a Full Stack Developer, Software Engineer, or similar role.
* You have at least 3 years experience building, deploying, and maintaining both the frontend and backend of modern web applications.
* You have at least 2 years experience working extensively in JavaScript/TypeScript code bases.
* You have strong problem-solving skills and the ability to debug complex issues effectively.
* You have a solid understanding of the uses and limitations of the standard building blocks of web services, e.g. REST, databases (relational and document), caches, message queues, serverless/server-based, transfer protocols, etc.
* You have a strongly rooted security mindset and the proclivity to build securely by default.
* You have experience collaborating with other developers in shared code bases, acting as a reviewer for others as well as having the ability to structure and explain your own code changes concisely.
* You have a proven ability to plan, execute, and complete development projects, both independently and in collaboration with others.
* You know when it's the right time to accept technical debt and when it's time to pay it off.



  





**Nice to haves** 



* Experience building B2B SaaS platforms
* Experience building enterprise services
* Experience working in start-up or scale-up businesses



  





**Toolkit** 



* Google Cloud Platform (Firebase, Firestore, AppEngine, Cloud Functions, PubSub, Memorystore, etc.)
* Amazon Web Services (EC2, CloudFront, S3, Lambda, RDS, Route53, Elastic Beanstalk, SQS, ElastiCache, etc.)
* MariaDB/MySQL, PostgreSQL, BigQuery
* JavaScript/TypeScript (Node.js, React, Webpack)
* HTTP Live Streaming (HLS), WebRTC, WebSocket
* Bash/Dash, Docker, Git, GitLab
* WooCommerce and Shopify for demo sites
* Gemini CLI, OpenAI APIs, Lovable, Cursor



*While we welcome applications from everywhere, please note that at this stage we are prioritizing candidates who are already based in Stockholm and eligible to work in Sweden without visa sponsorship.* 




  





**Curious to see Bambuser in action?** 




 Check out bambuser.com to explore how our platform powers shoppable video for brands worldwide. You’ll find product demos (Live, Shoppable Video, Video Consultation and Chat) and stories from some of the world’s most iconic retailers. If you’re excited about shaping the future of video commerce, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now and join us on the journey! 🚀
 



  





*This job ad was written by a human (alleged).*

title: Javautvecklare
description:
På Pensionsmyndigheten pågår just nu en spännande förändringsresa i att utveckla vårt nya förmånssystem från grunden vilket innebär en hel del nyutveckling. Nu söker vi flera Javautvecklare till Stockholm som är samarbetsinriktade och trivs med att arbeta i team!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Som Javautvecklare hos oss kommer du att ingå i ett team och arbetar utifrån en teambaserad organisation enligt det agila ramverket SAFe. Teamen hos oss är tvärfunktionella och självgående för att kunna hantera alla delar av utvecklingskedjan.
   

  

 Så här beskriver ett av våra team sig själv:
   

  

 ”Vi är ett självorganiserat hybridteam som jobbar enligt det agila ramverket SAFe. Vi arbetar i framkant med tekniska utmaningar som berör utveckling av nästa generations pensionssystem, baserat på mikrotjänster. Vi underlättar kvalitetssäkring av tjänster och system samt möjliggör kontinuerliga leveranser till test och produktion (CD/CI). Utöver det är vår vision att driva innovation och ta ansvar för arkitekturen genom att vara ledande inom vårt område. Tillsammans med teamet kommer du ha möjlighet att utvecklas och arbeta med teknik i framkant.”
   

  

**Din profil**
 Som person gillar du teamarbete där man delar med sig av kunskaper och lär av varandra. Du säger din mening, lyssnar på andras och är också bekväm i samarbete på distans då vi arbetar i distribuerade team. Du är också en problemlösare som gillar att omsätta komplexa krav till strukturerad kod och vill delta i att leda oss rätt i teknik och metodik.
   

  

 Vi bryr oss om vår kultur och hur vi tillsammans påverkar vår gemensamma arbetsplats. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som:
   

  

* är utbildad systemvetare, dataingenjör eller har skaffat dig motsvarande kunskaper på annat sätt
* har god Javakompetens och arbetslivserfarenhet som javautvecklare
* har erfarenhet av och trivs med att arbeta i agila team
* behärskar det svenska språket väl


 Det är meriterande om du:
   

  

* har erfarenhet av Spring Boot
* har erfarenhet av REST-tjänster och JMS
* har erfarenhet av byggprocessverktyg som Jenkins
* är väl bekant med något testramverk, exempelvis JUnit, Cucumber
* har erfarenhet av att arbeta med kod- och byggverktyg som Git och Maven
* har erfarenhet av en modern IDE, gärna IntelliJ


**Vi erbjuder**
 Ett myndighetsuppdrag som är viktigt på riktigt! En arbetsplats där vi värnar om att våra medarbetare ska ha en god balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi tillämpar hybridarbetssätt med möjlighet till distansarbete och på kontoret utifrån en överenskommelse med arbetsgivare. Som statligt anställd har du även goda anställningsvillkor och ett förmånspaket med friskvård, flexibel arbetstid, lediga klämdagar samt goda semester- och pensionsvillkor.
   

  

 Vårt kontor i Stockholm ligger i nära anslutning till Hornstulls tunnelbanestation där vi sitter i ljusa moderna lokaler.
   

  

 Du kan läsa mer om våra förmåner och hur det är att jobba hos oss här.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid och vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning.
   

  

 Anställningen kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass.
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 Vi kan komma att använda oss av arbetspsykologiska tester.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter kontakta rekryterande chef som hjälper dig med din ansökan.
   

  

 Vi strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och ser mångfald som en styrka och välkomnar därför sökande med olika bakgrund.
   

  

 Inför rekryteringsarbetet har vi tagit ställning till annonskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanber oss därför ytterligare kontakt med media-/annonsförsäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.
   

  

 Pensionsmyndigheten ansvarar för den allmänna pensionen och informerar om hela pensionen. Varje år betalar vi ut cirka 415 miljarder kronor till 2,3 miljoner pensionärer, genomför cirka 911 000 fondbyten och skickar ut 8 miljoner orange kuvert. Vi har ca 25 miljoner digitala kundkontakter per år. Vi är cirka 1700 medarbetare på åtta orter, från Luleå i norr till Halmstad i söder.
   

  

 #viktigtpåriktigt
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: PSL 2025-188 | Kontakt: Lars Nordström, Gruppchef , Ulrika Eriksson, Gruppchef , | Facklig företrädare: Michael Karlsson, ST 010-4543427, Rickard Rundgren, ST 010-4543115, Linda Modin, Saco-s 010-4543336, | Publicerat: 2025-11-27 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2026-01-11

title: System Architect – AI Operating System
description:
Voitto – Engineering the Foundations of Intelligent Systems
   

  

 At Voitto, we’re building the world’s first true AI Operating System—a revolutionary platform where AI autonomously designs tools, optimizes workflows, and reshapes business operations. We’re seeking an exceptional System Architect to engineer the fundamental layers that underpin our AI-driven systems.
   

  

 This isn’t just architecture—it’s pioneering the very foundations of intelligent systems.
   

  

 🎯 Your Mission
   

  

 You’ll architect and engineer the core infrastructure and system components that empower our autonomous AI agents. You will:
   

  

* Design highly efficient, scalable, and robust system architectures.
* Deeply understand fundamental components (such as data buses, storage blocks, system interfaces, and performance optimizations).
* Enable AI agents to interact seamlessly with all system layers, ensuring optimal performance and reliability.
* Continuously innovate system design to support the autonomous capabilities of our intelligent agents.


 🚀 About You
   

  

 You possess exceptional technical depth, enabling you to rapidly engineer and optimize system architectures:
   

  

* Profound understanding of underlying system components (buses, block sizes, storage architectures, I/O optimization).
* Ability to swiftly produce highly efficient and reliable architectural solutions—what might take others days, you achieve in minutes or hours.
* Passion for technical details and deep knowledge of how every layer of complex systems interacts.
* High energy and productivity—consistently able to deliver substantial outcomes rapidly.
* Strong hands-on coding abilities—comfortable not just designing but also implementing and refining system architectures.


 🛠 Your Role
   

  

* Lead the design and implementation of system architectures critical for autonomous AI operations.
* Rapidly prototype and iterate system designs to achieve peak performance and scalability.
* Collaborate closely with other architects (frontend, backend, AI) to ensure cohesive and optimized system integrations.
* Continuously refine system architecture in response to evolving technological insights and AI-driven demands.


 🌟 Must-Haves
   

  

* Extensive experience designing, coding, and optimizing complex system architectures.
* Deep technical expertise in system components and their interactions (storage, memory, I/O, buses).
* Proven ability to deliver fast, efficient, high-quality architectural solutions.
* High-energy, detail-oriented, and exceptionally productive mindset.
* Passion for innovation and fundamentally transforming how systems support autonomous AI.


 🌍 Why Voitto?
   

  

* Stockholm Office – Work from our innovative office in Stockholm.
* Groundbreaking Impact – Pioneer the infrastructure that redefines software development.
* Elite Team – Collaborate with top-tier professionals driven by innovation.
* Rapid Innovation – Fast-paced environment focused on quick iterations and impactful results.


 ✨ Ready to Architect the Future?
   

  

 We’re not looking for typical system architects—we’re seeking visionaries who engineer the future of intelligent systems.
   

  

 If you’re ready to redefine the foundation of software engineering, we want to hear from you.
   

  

**Voitto – Architecting Intelligent Systems That Build Themselves.**

title: System Engineer
description:
*Vill du arbeta med avancerade maskinsystem i teknikens absoluta framkant?* 




 Vi söker nu en erfaren systemingenjör till ett internationellt högteknologiskt bolag som utvecklar komplexa maskiner för industriella tillämpningar. Rollen passar dig som vill arbeta långsiktigt med produktutveckling i stora, tvärfunktionella utvecklingsprojekt.
 



  





  





**Om rollen** 




 Som systemingenjör blir du en nyckelperson i produktutvecklingen och arbetar i gränslandet mellan mekanik, elektronik, mjukvara och hårdvara. Du ansvarar för att säkerställa att systemets olika delar fungerar tillsammans som en helhet – från kravnedbrytning till integration, verifiering och validering. Arbetet sker i nära samarbete med specialister inom mekanik, elektronik, mekatronik, firmware och mjukvara. Fokus ligger på komplexa fysiska maskiner där systemförståelse, struktur och långsiktighet är avgörande för att lyckas
 **.** 




  





**Arbetsuppgift** 
 er
 


* Arbeta med systemarkitektur och systemdesign i komplexa maskinsystem
* Driva och koordinera integration mellan mekanik, elektronik och mjukvara
* Säkerställa verifiering och validering av system och delsystem
* Delta i kravarbete och säkerställa spårbarhet genom utvecklingsprocessen
* Arbeta i tvärfunktionella team i långsiktiga produktutvecklingsprojekt
* Bidra till struktur, metodik och kvalitet i systemutvecklingsarbetet



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




 Vi söker dig som har:
 


* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av produktutveckling i rollen som systemingenjör eller liknande
* Erfarenhet av arbete i tvärfunktionella utvecklingsteam
* Stark bakgrund inom integration, verifiering och/eller validering
* Erfarenhet av komplexa fysiska produkter med kombination av mekanik, elektronik och mjukvara
* God förståelse för produktutvecklingsprocesser i industriell miljö



 Bakgrund inom halvledarindustrin är meriterande. Extra meriterande är erfarenhet från områden som litografi eller inspektionssystem.
 



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 



* Strukturerad och analytisk med god helhetssyn
* Kommunikativ och van att samarbeta över teknikgränser
* Trivs i komplexa miljöer och långsiktiga utvecklingsprojekt
* Nyfiken, lösningsorienterad och kvalitetsmedveten



  





**Övrig information** 




 Start: Enligt överenskommelse
 



 Plats: Täby
 



 Anställningsform: Detta är ett konsultuppdrag med en anställning hos oss på A-hub med möjlighet till en direktanställning hos slutkund efter 6 månader.

title: Principal Engineer, Game Production
description:
**Craft:**
 Technology & Development
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Hiring in locations:**
* Barcelona, Spain
* Stockholm, Sweden
* London, UK


 We are looking for an experienced engineer to join the Game Production organization, working in the Live Edit team. This team plays a key role in enhancing our production workflows by building tools and technologies that allow artists, designers, and producers to visualize and interact with game content efficiently.
   

  

 Our engineers are at the heart of our development process — talented generalists who not only deliver high-quality code but also contribute to improving the way we build and experience our games.
   

  

 You are passionate about programming, technology, and architecture, with a strong focus on quality and innovation. You enjoy solving complex problems, designing scalable systems, and understanding the full technical stack. A solid understanding of game development pipelines and what makes a great player experience is highly valued.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams across Game Production, Graphics, and Game Teams to deliver tools that have a real impact on how we create and refine our games.
   

  

 Your role within the Kingdom
   

  

* As a Principal Engineer, you are an excellent C++ Developer with a focus on code quality.
* You are expected to improve your team’s communication and collaboration, and effectiveness.
* Facilitating cross-functional and cross-business unit alignment, providing clear and timely information to all stakeholders, and driving informed decision-making.
* You actively encourage the sharing of knowledge and make sure that important information is easily accessible to everyone.
* You have in-depth knowledge of C++ and you can identify and apply relevant software engineering concepts, architect complex systems, and actively take part in game creation.
* You challenge the quality standards and are accountable for the quality of the systems and components owned by the teams you work with and collaborate with.
* You facilitate and drive the investigation and mitigation of live incidents and enable detection and prevention mechanisms against future issues, and have in-depth knowledge of production environments.
* As a principal Engineer, you foster a culture of autonomy and accountability across multiple teams, promoting self-management and ownership, setting the direction and defining the scope of work.
* This role is for an R&D space that encourages experimentation and design innovation.
* You should possess the drive to push things forward and be unafraid of challenges.
* You should be enthusiastic about tackling problems of varying complexity within a team setting. You will play a pivotal role in defining the architecture, design, stories, and task breakdowns, as well as coordinating technical synchronization. You will need to examine various options and actively assist the team in making decisions regarding technical solutions and processes, including collaborating with the tech leadership team.


 Skills to create thrills
   

  

* Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent required.
* Excellent communication and leadership skills with experienced inter-department tech communication.
* Excellent teamwork skills, proactiveness, flexibility, and ability to handle multiple tasks.
* Previous experience working with C++ projects.
* Previous experience with gaming is a plus.


 With us you’ll get to work at the forefront of casual social gaming business, in a growing, energized and fun environment. At King you’re always smack in the middle of the game development, contributing with not only your kick ass programming skills but also with your passion for games and how to build them.
   

  

**About King**
 With a mission of
 *Making the World Playful* 
 , King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as
 *Farm Heroes Sag* 
 a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king\_games on X.

title: Senior Software Engineer (C++), Frostbite
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 Frostbite is EA's proprietary game engine. Its versatile tools and cutting-edge technology power creation on some of the world's most iconic and visually stunning games, including titles from EA SPORTS and Battlefield. Frostbite provides a unified platform that empowers developers to create hyper-realistic worlds, intricate gameplay, and lifelike animations with unmatched speed and quality. By joining Frostbite, you'll be at the forefront of game engine innovation, collaborating with top-tier developers to push the boundaries of interactive realism and immersive gameplay. Shape the future of gaming technology and leave your mark on the next generation of games.
   

  

 You Will Work On Systems For Data Management And Game Asset Processing, Improving Our Content Creator Workflows And Allowing Faster Iteration Times. Some Examples Of The Systems That You Might Work With
   

  

* The system that provides on-disk data to our editor
* The pipeline for creating game-ready data
* A caching system for built data
* A service for On-demand loading


 This is a hybrid remote/in-office role in Vancouver or Stockholm and you will report to a Development Director.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* You will provide architectural guidance and technical expertise to enhance performance, profiling, and optimization
* You will partner with the wider Frostbite engineering team to define strategic direction
* You will collaborate on design, testing, and maintenance efforts
* You will enhance tools, processes, and best practices
* You will work with leadership to develop roadmaps
* You will communicate with game and Frostbite teams to understand their needs and support them in using our technologies
* You will acquire and share domain expertise


**Qualifications**
* 7+ years of experience with C++ programming, data-guided design, and software architecture
* Experienced in building high-performing concurrent software
* Comfortable working within an established codebase
* Experience with Agile development practices
* Experience of data processing and data management
* Experience implementing databases or file systems
* Some experience with web services running locally and in Azure
* Some experience with content pipelines


**Compensation And Benefits**
 The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs).
   

  

**PAY RANGES**
* British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria) \*$138,700 - $199,900 CAD


 In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.
   

  

**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: Geotechnical Software Solutions Engineer
description:
**Job Title:** 
 Geotechnical Software Solutions Engineer
   

  

**Location:** 
 Sweden (Danderyd or Gothenburg), Norway (Sandvika), Finland (Espoo), UK (Leeds)
   

  

**Job Summary**
 Due to significant growth opportunities for the Trimble Geosuite product line in existing markets (Sweden and Norway) and new markets (Finland and the UK), Trimble is making a key investment in the Geosuite team and product. We are expanding the team and invite you to join us.
   

  

 This role offers a unique opportunity to directly
 **impact and improve the digital data flow for Geotechnical engineers** 
 by integrating precise positioning, modeling, data analytics technologies and the use of agentic AI. You will be instrumental in transforming how work gets done in the geotechnical field by developing solutions that connect the physical and digital worlds.
   

  

**We Offer You**
* A dynamic and innovative work environment
* Mentoring and coaching for personal and professional growth
* A global company with a strong and successful team
* Versatile and challenging tasks
* A culture of passion to help each other succeed
* A competitive compensation package
* Career opportunities within product management


**What You Will Do**
 As a Geotechnical Software Solutions Engineer, your daily work will be varied, providing you with the possibility to influence all aspects of software development, including product management, development, customer relations, and assisting sales. You will work closely with the existing Geosuite team and receive comprehensive onboarding and mentoring. This is a global team, requiring flexibility for occasional meetings outside of standard working hours.
   

  

**Specifically, you will drive the improvement of geotechnical data flow through the following key responsibilities:**
* Innovating Data Solutions: Work with customers to understand their challenges and help them succeed with our geotechnical solutions, with a focus on streamlining their workflows and improving data exchange.
* Product Vision & Specification: Actively participate in shaping the Geosuite roadmap, discussing the future direction of the product line, and defining new functionality to enhance data management and analysis. Work with specifications of new functionality, collaborating with developers on the implementation of features that specifically improve data flow and connectivity. Helping to ensure efficient workflows across all related Trimble products
* Domain Expertise & Sales Support: Provide specific domain expertise to the sales team, demonstrating how the Geosuite product line facilitates better data-driven decisions.
* Customer Engagement & Training: Provide customer support and online training, helping users maximize the efficiency and insights gained from the Trimble Geosuite data ecosystem.
* Marketing & Industry Representation: Actively participate in marketing activities (conferences, presentations, demo videos, etc.) to showcase the value of enhanced digital data workflows in geotechnical engineering Ensure Trimble's presence in technical working groups and industry associations to stay at the forefront of data flow standards and innovation.
* Quality Assurance: Carry out Geosuite software testing to ensure robust and reliable data handling capabilities.
* Some domestic and international travel to customer sites is required.


**What Skills And Experience You Should Bring**
* Geotechnical Background: A BSc or MSc in Geotechnical Engineering (or other relevant background) with experience in the field.
* Communication: Fluent English language skills (written and spoken). Additionally, depending on the location, fluent Swedish, Norwegian, or Finnish may be required.
* Collaboration: Good people skills to effectively interact with colleagues, cross-functional teams, and third parties.


**About the location**
 This is a full-time position based in one of our offices: Sweden (Danderyd or Gothenburg), Norway (Sandvika), Finland (Espoo), or UK (Leeds). We expect you to work in the office at least four days per week.
   

  

**About Trimble**
 Trimble is a global technology company that connects the physical and digital worlds, transforming the ways work gets done. With relentless innovation in precise positioning, modeling and data analytics, Trimble enables essential industries including construction, geospatial and transportation. Whether it's helping customers build and maintain infrastructure, design and construct buildings, optimize global supply chains or map the world, Trimble is at the forefront, driving productivity and progress.
   

  

**www.trimble.com**
**About Geosuite**
 Geosuite is a complete, industry-leading geotechnical solution offering a life cycle workflow for geotechnical data. Born from a unique collaboration between customers, industry, authorities, and universities starting in the 1990s, Geosuite has a unique position, and it has been the standard tool for geotechnicians in Sweden and Norway for decades, used in all types of infrastructure and building projects.
   

  

**https://construction.trimble.com/en/products/novapoint-geosuite**
**#geotechnicaljobs**
**#geotechnicalsoftware**
****How to Apply:****
 Please submit an online application for this position by clicking on the ‘Apply Now’ button located in this posting.
   

  

****Join a Values-Driven Team: Belong, Grow, Innovate.****
 At Trimble, our core values of Belong, Grow, and Innovate aren't just words—they're the foundation of our culture. We foster an environment where you are seen, heard, and valued (Belong); where you have an opportunity to build a career and drive our collective growth (Grow); and where your innovative ideas shape the future (Innovate). We believe in empowering local teams to create impactful strategies, ensuring our global vision resonates with every individual. Become part of a team where your contributions truly matter.
   

  

 Trimble’s Privacy Policy
   

  

 If you need assistance or would like to request an accommodation in connection with the application process, please contact AskPX@px.trimble.com.

title: Senior Game Developer - Paper.io2
description:
**About Voodoo**
 Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.
   

  

 This position can be Paris-based, Barcelona-based, Amsterdam-based, or fully remote within CET +/-2h.
   

  

 Team
   

  

 Our Gaming team is made up of hybrid-casual, casual, and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing, and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.
   

  

 Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient hybrid games generating more than $20m per year, we are the world's largest and most successful hybrid publisher.
   

  

 You will be joining one of our Live Studios, working on
 **Paper.io 2** 
**.**
 With Paper.io 2, we’re building an iconic game that players will never forget!
   

  

 We're a small team of excellent people who take care of everything from ideas to testing, and we intend to grow while maintaining our high standards.
   

  

 Role
   

  

 We are looking for a talented Senior Game Developer with a good understanding of the casual mobile game market to help the team deliver fun, innovative, and entertaining features. You will take an innovative approach to gameplay ideas/features and give them their own spin.
   

  

* Responsibilities will align with your strengths
* Work on core gameplay improvements
* Develop new meta features
* Enhance and refine existing systems


 With this role, you will have a strong impact on the company by contributing daily to important decisions with a senior, multidisciplinary team of passionate and talented people. Flesh out the details of a game's design, oversee its testing, and revise the game in response to player feedback. Thanks to your creativity and your teamwork, let’s entertain millions of people with your hit games.
   

  

 Profile
   

  

* 5+ years of professional experience in C# and Unity
* Proven track record in successful mobile game development
* Exceptional expertise in a specialized area (e.g., animation, particle systems, shaders, architecture, performance optimization or networking) is a major plus
* Strong problem-solving skills with a focus on optimization and performance
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
* A creative, hands-on developer with a passion for quality work


**Benefits**
* Best-in-class compensation
* Other benefits according to the country you reside
